<![endif]-->  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><b style="">Fandom: </b>Sherlock<br /><b style="">Title: </b>The Case of Blind Beauty<br /><b style="">Pairing: </b>Sherlock/Lestrade<br /><b style="">Word Count: </b>5000 (in two parts thanks to LJ)<br /><b style="">Rating: </b>NC-17<br /><b style="">Summary: </b>Lestrade doesn’t believe he’s beautiful enough for Sherlock to stay in love with him. Can Sherlock convince him otherwise?<br /><b style="">Disclaimer: </b>I’m not ACD, or the Moff, or Gatiss, or Aunty Beeb. No profit is being made from this.<br /><b style="">Author’s note: </b>written for a <lj user="sherlockbbc_fic"/>  prompt.  I needed to write something porny in between all my angst fics. Instead, I wrote angst with the teeniest bit of porn.<o:p></o:p></p>                  <lj-cut text="The Case of Blind Beauty (part 1)"><p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><b style=""><u>The Case of Blind Beauty<o:p></o:p></u></b></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><b style=""><u><o:p><span style="text-decoration: none;"> </span></o:p></u></b></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Sherlock?” John knocks on the bedroom door. There’s no answer. There hasn’t been an answer for days. “Are you sure he’s in there?” John asks Mrs. Hudson. Mrs. Hudson shrugs but he can see she’s worried. Truth be told, John is starting to worry himself. True, Sherlock warned him that he might not talk for days but John dismissed that because Sherlock never had had anyone to talk to before. Sherlock always talked to John.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Ooh, what if he’s done something stupid?” Mrs. Hudson frets.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Don’t worry about him.” John assures her. “I’ll take care of it.” John gives her a dismissing smile. “You go back to your room and have a nice cup of tea. It’ll be nothing. I’m sure of it.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Oh, very well.” She gives in, retreating to her room. John makes sure she has gone before he bangs on Sherlock’s door again. “Sherlock, open up!” John demands. “You’ve made Mrs. Hudson worried. That’s not very nice of you. Sherlock!” John pounds the door in frustration, before shoulder barging it. All that does is hurt his shoulder, making him wince in pain. He curses, using the pain and anger to kick the door in. “Oh, Sherlock.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Sherlock is cuddled up in a tight ball, hugging his duvet, dressed in green silk pyjamas. His eyes are red and he’s clutching a handwritten note.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Sherlock?” John questions. He’s never seen Sherlock like this. “Please can I see the note?” Sherlock blinks, his eyes adjusting as he begins to realise John’s presence.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“But it’s wrong.” Sherlock says, his voice small, like a little boy’s. Sherlock is pouting and his eyes are watering. He lets go of the letter and uses both hands to clutch the duvet, spooning it. John picks up the letter and reads it silently.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">Dearest Sherlock,<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">Let me start by saying that you are the most beautiful person I have ever met. You have an air of innocence that is so rare in our profession; you have the curiosity of a child; you have a sharp mind and a sharper tongue; you have a sculpted body; you are perfect in your imperfections. I do love you so much.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">I don’t want to write this next part, but I fear I must. You deserve far better than me. I am a distraction. I don’t know why you decided to pursue a relationship with me, I am very grateful but it can not last. Surely you must see that. We’re not compatible. We are both married to the job. I cannot give you the love you deserve.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">You deserve someone smart, someone young and beautiful and all the things I am not. You deserve the best. I am not that man.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">You deserve someone with courage. Clearly that isn’t me since I am hiding behind a sheet of paper. The second I see you I am overwhelmed by your beauty and intellect, I can’t bring myself to end this, even though I know it is the best thing for you. I don’t understand why you chose me but it was a foolish decision, I hope you see that now.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">I know it’s terribly old-fashioned for me to be telling you this in a note, but that is my point. You are young and enthusiastic and full of energy and vigour. I am an old, boring man, who enjoys routine and takes pleasure in relaxing. Please don’t hate me. I don’t think I could bear it if your wit and anger was directed at me.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">I am doing this for you.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">You are so, very beautiful.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">Kindest Regards,<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">G Lestrade.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">John is speechless. He never knew, never even guessed. Sherlock has always been so dismissive of Lestrade, although he does talk about him regularly. Sherlock always has acted frustrated by Lestrade. A lot of people cause Sherlock frustration, but Lestrade seems to cause extra frustration. Now that John thinks about it, Lestrade does seem to get under Sherlock’s skin, far more than any other police man, far more than anybody else. It does make a lot of sense now, now that John considers Sherlock’s feelings.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Sherlock may declare himself as a ‘high-functioning sociopath’ but it’s clear he does have feelings, strong ones, and he must have acknowledged them in some form to have started a relationship in the first place, if it were Sherlock who instigated it. John somehow doubts Lestrade would have had the confidence or self-perception.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Sherlock?” John asks, helplessly. It’s a lot to take in, and he’s still processing the new information he has learned but he knows a little something about bad break-ups. He wants to comfort Sherlock. He wants to help him.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Go away John.” Sherlock sniffs. “Leave me alone.” Sherlock snatches the letter from John’s hands and returns to his position, curled up on the bed, body curled around his duvet. John leaves reluctantly, somewhat baffled.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">*****</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">John knocks on the door of Lestrade’s office. Lestrade sounds so weary as he tells whoever it is to come in. He freezes when he sees John. So does John.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Lestrade’s lips are chapped, there are dark circles under his eyes, his eyes are red-rimmed and his hair is tousled, like he hasn’t had the chance or motivation to run a comb through it.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“You look terrible.” John blurts out, tactlessly.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Thank you.” Lestrade replies, returning to his paperwork, sighing before squinting and reluctantly putting on his reading glasses. “No, I mean it. Thank you John. At least you’re honest. Everybody else is treating me with kid gloves, ignoring an elephant in the middle of the room. Doesn’t make any sense.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I read the note.” John continues bluntly. Lestrade is struck by a coughing fit so violent he would have been sick if he had anything to regurgitate. “Crap, are you okay?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“You see why I had to do it, don’t you?” Lestrade asks, shrugging John’s hand off his back.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Not really, no.” John admits.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“He deserves someone better, someone younger; fitter; smarter; handsomer. He deserves someone like you.” Lestrade tells John. John scoffs.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I’m straight and Sherlock already has the best boyfriend he could wish for.” John replies. “Well, had. You’re a good catch, Lestrade.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Not for him.” Lestrade argues. “Stop looking at me like that, I’ve done what’s best for him.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I’m not so sure about that.” John mutters.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I am.” Lestrade sounds so certain, so dejected. Like a dog that has stopped wagging its tail, John wants to adopt him. “Sherlock is special. I’m not.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“You are to him.” John tries to tell Lestrade but Lestrade just shakes his head.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Sherlock is an observant guy.” Lestrade smiles fondly. It’s clear Lestrade loves Sherlock, it’s evident in his eyes, but Lestrade’s eyes also betray a sadness, convinced he could never be loved back. “I don’t get what he sees in me.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Can’t you just trust that he does see it?” John asks</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I trust him with my career.” Lestrade replies. “I can’t trust him with my heart as well.” Lestrade coughs again, clutching his stomach because he no doubt feels sick. John can tell he hasn’t slept in days, living on a diet of caffeine and paperwork. The caffeine is keeping his heart-rate up but the lack of food and sleep is slowly weakening him. It’s not long until he collapses from exhaustion.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“And what about Sherlock?” John presses, a little desperately. “You’ve broken his heart.” Lestrade shakes his head, his eyes welling up with tears he doesn’t want to shed. “He loves you.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“He can’t.” Lestrade says, slightly frantic. “He can’t love me, he’s smarter than that. He’s young and beautiful. He’ll bounce back. He’ll meet someone worthy. Someone who can keep up with his intellect. He’ll forget about me. He has to. It isn’t love.” Lestrade is adamant about that. “He’s too beautiful to love me.” John can feel the tears welling up in his own eyes. He half-runs out of the office until he’s out of the building. Then he leans against the wall, curls up and cries.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">So much pain! And he’s not even the one in love.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">***</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I spoke to Lestrade.” John mentions casually whilst Sherlock is reading the paper the next day.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Really?” Sherlock tries to feign disinterest. It lasts about a second. “How is he?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Terrible.” John confesses. “He’s taking the break-up worse than you.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“He broke it off.” Sherlock says, his voice painfully steady.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I know.” John admits. “He’s still hurting though. Throwing himself into his work, making himself ill with neglect.” John can hear Sherlock sniff and wipe away the tears that are forming.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Then why did he break it off?” Sherlock asks, breaking down into tears.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I don’t know.” John sighs. “I think he feels that he doesn’t deserve your love.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“That’s absurd!” Sherlock exclaims.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I know.” John agrees. “I’ve never met a man who deserves to be loved as much as Lestrade. It was painful, to hear him talk about himself.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“How do you mean?” Sherlock asks, concerned, intrigued, and anxious.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Just the way he dismissed himself, the way he neglects himself, the way he thinks he’s so inferior to you. It’s all bullshit, of course, but he actually believes it.” John recalls, amazed. “He’s terrified of the fact you love him, so convinced he doesn’t deserve it that he actually thinks you’ll be able to move on so easily, that it’s just some childish crush of yours and once you’ve realised, you’ll hate him for tricking you into thinking it was love.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“He said that?” Sherlock’s voice is fraught, it’s clear he’s trying hard not to cry which is understandable because John himself is torn between anger and sadness.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Not in so many words.” John admits. “But the letter said it. That he thinks you’re too good for him. I mean, jeez, has he met you?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“He loves me but cannot concede the fact that I love him?” Sherlock mulls over this problem before coming up with solution. “Then I must convince him of it!” Sherlock declares, before enquiring, “How do I do that?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Why, write him a letter of course.” Mrs. Hudson’s voice supplies. “Sorry dears, I just thought I would bring you some comfort food since you’ve been feeling so down lately.” She hands Sherlock an entire chocolate cake, John a bag of cookies, putting the rest of the junk food in the cupboards and the ice cream in the freezer. “I was ever so sorry to hear about your break-up. Oh, he is such a nice chap. I bet it really hurt him to write that. Oh dear, I hope he’s taking care of himself.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Mrs. Hudson, what do you know?” Sherlock demands to be told.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I was cleaning your room when I happened upon the letter he wrote you, poor thing. I never suspected he’d be so self-conscious but I should have really. Not lucky in love but too polite to complain or speak up, throwing himself into his work instead. Bless him. Must have thrown him off his balance to have a pretty man like you fall for him. Not what he’s used to. Still, I never thought he’d doubt himself so much as to write you that letter-“</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Mrs. Hudson, please.” Sherlock begs. “Tell me what I can do to fix this, tell me what the problem is, what have I done wrong?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Oh, you’ve done nothing wrong, love.” Mrs. Hudson smiles. “He’s just scared, poor darling. Makes me thing no one has ever loved him before, and that would be sad. He is so very lovable and it is such a wonderful feeling. That’s what he’s scared of, see? It’s daft really. To be scared of needing someone, especially when they need you back, it’s tragic. He must have been so starved of love, not to recognise it, to be so hungry for it he avoid it, so scared he’ll become addicted to it.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Mrs. Hudson, please...” Sherlock sobs, shocking her a little. He regains his composure quickly, but now she knows. “Tell me how to get him back. I need him.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Then tell him that.” She instructs softly. “Write a letter assuring him of your love, of your commitment to him. He may doubt it at first. Don’t let him.” She says, smiling softly, encouragingly.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“That’s all?” Sherlock is surprised.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Love is all.” She replies. Sherlock nods and retreats to his bedroom to start working on the letter.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">*****</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">My Dearest Lestrade,<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">You wrote me a letter, highlighting your feelings for me. I think it’s only fair that I reciprocate the gesture.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">I love you. I know you love me. Why can’t we be together?<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">It hurt, reading your letter. I cried, and I’m still not quite sure why. It still hurts, to think of it. It hurts to feel rejected. I’ve been rejected by society, that’s nothing, I don’t want to be part of society, I can do without it. I can’t do without you.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">I used to think it was a weakness. The need for social contact. Now I crave your touch. Your voice. Your warmth. They make me feel safe, they make me feel happy. You make me feel happy. Silly emotions I never paid much attention to before. Now, I’m unhappy without you. I’m miserable.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">I don’t understand your letter, I can’t comprehend it. You are a loyal, dependable, trustworthy man. You are hard-working, dedicated and under-appreciated. You are selfless and kind and gentle. You are charming and lovely and deserve to be loved. You are beautiful. I don’t deserve you but I know you love me and I need that love.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">I don’t like this letter, it isn’t right. I can’t find the right words. It is frustrating. I’m not very good at expressing my emotions, so much so that at times I find it easier to ignore them. I can’t ignore my feelings for you. I love you and that isn’t going away, believe me, I’ve tried. I don’t want to ignore it any longer. <o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">I want to kiss you. I want to hold your hand in public. I want to make you smile, make you blush. I want the world to know that I love you. I want you to know that I love you. Know that I find you beautiful. When I am bored, or lonely, or sad, or happy, I want to share it with you. <o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">This is an inadequate letter, but I hope you understand. <o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">I love you. I need you. Why can’t we be together?<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">Yours Forever,<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">Sherlock<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">*****</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Sherlock is unreasonably nervous as he stands outside the Inspector’s office, gathering the courage to knock on the door. He has the letter tucked securely in his jacket pocket, he checked 12 times on the journey. He hopes the Inspector can decipher his handwriting because he did try to make it his neatest.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Sherlock recognises the fact that he is procrastinating. He takes a deep breath and knocks several times on the door.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Come in.” Lestrade growls. Sherlock involuntarily shivers, questions what the fuck is wrong with him that a clearly over-worked, exhausted and annoyed Lestrade just saying two words can reduce him to such a state. Sherlock scolds himself, forces his knees not to turn to jelly and then promptly goes in.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“John was right, you do look terrible.” Sherlock voices, concerned.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Sorry?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“John told me you looked terrible. He was right.” Sherlock repeats, and only then does he hear the words and inwardly curses.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Well, thank you for telling me something I already know Sherlock, it’s not often you do that.” Lestrade comments, smugly before he has a coughing fit that almost knocks him off his chair.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Here.” Sherlock thrusts a bottle of cough mixture into Lestrade’s hand, refusing to acknowledge that his own hand is shaking. “It’s from John. He told me to bring it. Mrs. Hudson wanted me to bring you a casserole she baked too but I refused. I assured her that you’re not a complete idiot. You may have a rubbish diet of snack bars and take out but you don’t forget to eat all together. Congratulations on proving me wrong.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Sherlock, what are you doing here?” Lestrade asks, having taken a swig of the cough medicine.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Having a panic attack by the feel of it.” Sherlock replies. At first Lestrade just thinks he’s joking, Sherlock doesn’t panic; but he’s breathing far too shallowly and often, taking in far too much oxygen, he looks pale, as though he’s going to pass out.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Sherlock, sit down!” Lestrade orders, standing up so he can pull out the other chair for Sherlock to collapse in. Which Sherlock promptly does collapse in, burying his head in his hands. “Are you okay?” Lestrade knows it’s a stupid question before he’s asked it.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“No, I’m not okay!” Sherlock exclaims, whilst hyperventilating. “I can’t eat, I can’t sleep.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“You never eat or sleep.” Lestrade points out.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I know, but this is different and I can’t think why. It’s terrible. I can’t think! You’ve reduced me to a fucking cliché, butterflies in my stomach and everything, that’s a disgusting sentiment. And I can’t do anything. I can’t function-“</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Sherlock, breathe.” Lestrade tells him, worried. He places a hand on Sherlock’s back, telling him to relax. It’s too much. Lestrade is standing too close, his scent mixed in with the feel on his hand on Sherlock’s back... Sherlock breaks down and cries. Lestrade winces as Sherlock tries to regain control, but it takes several minutes. Lestrade waits and watches uncomfortably. “Sherlock, why did you come here?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I came here to talk to you about the letter you sent me.” Sherlock says, very carefully.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“You’ve thought it over, realised I was right and have decided to settled down with your Doctor friend?” Lestrade hopefully suggests.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“What? No!” Sherlock gasps. “Why is everybody so obsessed with getting me and John together? He’s straight and I already have the best boyfriend ever. Well, I would, except he’s being absurd and it’s crazy that he doesn’t know how handsome and lovable and fucking huggable he is, although I’m worried the second he realises all of that he’s not going to want to be with me any more because I am a fucking mess!” Sherlock screams, frustrated and scared and a whole load of other emotions he does not know how to handle.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Sherlock?” Lestrade questions, fear shining in his big brown eyes.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I miss you.” Sherlock whispers, his voice raw and the tears flow freely when he sees Lestrade shaking his head.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Don’t.” It’s a plea, from Lestrade’s beautiful lips.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I don’t want to. I can’t help it.” Sherlock confesses, making Lestrade cry. “I have a letter.” Sherlock remembers, giving Lestrade the letter. “Please, promise me you’ll read it.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Sherlock, I can’t.” Lestrade sighs, sadly, and Sherlock would like nothing more than to kiss the pout off of the Inspector’s lips. He’s never wanted anything so badly. “I have work to do.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“There are more important things in life than work George!” Sherlock snaps, sincerely. It’s a revelation Lestrade never thought he would hear from Sherlock’s lips. It does make him think. “Promise me, please?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I promise.” Lestrade mutters and Sherlock nods. “Now please, leave me alone.” The simple request makes Sherlock sob a little, so he takes inhales deeply before reluctantly leaving.<span style="">  </span>Lestrade takes a deep breath, before continuing to try and work.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">*****</p></lj-cut><p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/73084.html">part two</a></p></meta></meta></meta></meta>

<![endif]-->  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><b style="">Fandom: </b>Doctor Who<br /><b style="">Title: </b>Torture (06/08ish)<br /><b style="">Characters: </b>Rory and a new incarnation of The Master<br /><b style="">Rating: </b>NC-17, very violent and dark.<b style=""><br />Warning: </b>This series includes death, mutilation and torture.<br /><b style="">Word Count: </b>1400<br /><b style="">Summary: </b>The Master has made Rory witness murder, expanded his brainwaves, extracted his thoughts, sexually and mentally abused him but Rory hasn’t broken. Now he’s implanting memories into Rory. That seems to break him.<br /><b style="">Disclaimer: </b>I really don’t own Doctor Who, this isn’t for profit.<br /><b style="">Author’s Notes: </b>written for <lj comm="eleventy_kink"/> . <br /><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/70107.html">part one</a><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/70147.html">part two</a><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/70551.html">part three</a><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/71003.html">part four</a><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/71807.html">part five</a></p>                  <p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"> </p><lj-cut text="Torture (06)"><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><b style=""><u>Torture<o:p></o:p></u></b></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Rory wakes, the pain gone but his mind is fuzzy. He feels weak. He hasn’t eaten or had anything to drink in what feels like days. But he’s alive. He remembers being shot. He shouldn’t be alive. Although this wouldn’t be the first time he had come back from the dead.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Nanogenes.” The Master tells him. “Fix you up, as good as new. Terribly hard to get whilst stranded on this planet. You should be honoured I’m wasting them on you.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“You need me alive.” Rory says. He’d forgotten what his own voice sounded like. Now his throat isn’t sore, there’s no rope blocking out his voice. “Dead men don’t think.” Rory says: his thoughts are for the safety of Amy, the Doctor and the TARDIS. He may no longer be gagged but he is still bound. His fingers are no longer broken, but he can no longer feel the ring on his finger.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Your thoughts are boring.” The Master dismisses. “2000 years and you cling to the boring stuff. You’re impossible Rory. Almost as impossible as your wife. I’ll burn the whole universe if that’s what it takes for me to get to her.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“You’d have to find her first.” Rory replies. He doesn’t know where she is, and he trusts the Doctor to keep her safe, which makes the Master laugh.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“You can’t protect her.” The Master sneers, zoning in on Rory’s weakness and exploiting it. “Just like you couldn’t protect my wife.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“No! That’s not-“ It’s not how Rory remembers it, but his memory is distorted, his whole vision is distorted. He can see... waves coming off the Master. He’s sometimes seen the Doctor with the same waves, like an aura except the Master’s is far more profound. It’s energy. He’s seen it in the TARDIS most but Rory had always dismissed it, questioning his sanity.<span style="">  </span>“You killed her. You killed them both.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Oh, only in this timeline. And perhaps a few thousand others.” The Master replies flippantly. “You can see it, can’t you?” Rory can see. Only vaguely, out of focus. So much death: such cruelty. Rory tries not to see it but it suddenly gets sharper, individual timelines pouring into his brain, so many at a time, so tragic, he sees Chastity being stabbed, he sees her being strangled, he sees her being beaten and raped, he sees her miscarrying and falling into depression. It’s too much but there’s nothing he can do to stop it. So many possibilities and they’re all real. It’s not long before he can no longer tell which version was from his reality. “You can see it.” The Master states, victoriously.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“What is it? What am I seeing?” Rory asks, the horrible images flickering through his mind.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Oh, come on Rory, you’re smarter than that.” The Master smiles, encouragingly. He crouches down, closer to Rory but Rory doesn’t flinch. He’s practically catatonic.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Events from alternate universes.” Rory says. “How am I seeing them? I shouldn’t be seeing them.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I’ve told you before Rory. You’re not human.” The Master repeats, like a teacher repeating a fact to a forgetful student. Being human is a concept that means so much to Rory, the Master isn’t quite sure why. It’s quite an elaborate plan, to destroy Rory’s humanity. It can’t be done in this universe, and therefore he’ll show him others. It’s a Time Lord’s gift, the perception of Time and Space and the differences thereof. Knowing when timelines split and alternate universes are formed. Universes, like grains of sand which can be looked at individually but are usually walked upon indiscriminately.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I am human.” Rory insists.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“No, no human could endure this.” The Master smiles, patiently. “Even some Time Lords can’t endure this, and they were born for it. Too much. Is it too much for you?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Stop it.” Rory begs.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Why?” The Master questions. “This is fun.” Rory starts sobbing. The Master’s smile grows. “Going through the different possibilities. Seeing the thousands of ways a person can die. Do you remember? Oh, that was a good universe. You found your way to this backwards little planet, you bumped into Charity, like you’ve done in thousand of others realities. You delivered her baby, oh so many times. Do you remember the time it was still-born? Ha! I never even had to kill it. Or my beloved wife. She tried to slit her wrists, and when you wouldn’t let her, she stabbed you.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I remember.” Rory cries. “But it isn’t real!”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Oh, it’s all real Rory. You know that. Just because it’s not your reality, that doesn’t make you care any less. Does it?” The Master licks Rory’s tears, tasting the energy within them. “You bled out, as you watched her hang herself. Oh, and it doesn’t end there. Go on, keep watching. Tell me what happens next.” Rory sobs at the Master’s request, but he does as he’s told.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“The Doctor finds me first, I’m barely breathing, too little blood left in my body, even his sonic screwdriver can’t save me. I tell him, my dying wish is that he loves Amy. It was just the two of them before, and she was happy. I just want her to be happy, but she cries, oh, she cries. She runs slower than usually. Too slow to be the Doctor’s companion. She’s killed. And the Doctor never gets over her. He’s captured and tortured, he’s put in a cage but he doesn’t fight back. He just withers away, refusing to regenerate. What a waste, what a waste.” Rory cries.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Everything is wasted.” The Master tells him. “The years spent, you protecting your wife. You remember all the universes where it failed. The universes that cease to exist, but not in your mind. You can see, the points where they diverge in Time. You can see where you could have fixed them.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“But I did fix it.” Rory insists. “I protected Amy. She was able to reboot the Universe. She brought the Doctor back.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Not always.” The Master counters. “Can you see?” The Master laughs, “Can you see the Universe where you waited 2000 years for Amy to come out of that box, can you remember it? All that time waiting for her, only you forgot, didn’t you? You forgot why you were waiting. The box was dangerous, that’s what people told you. A prison. So when she came out of it, you shot her.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I didn’t. I wouldn’t.” Rory stutters.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Oh but you did.” The Master assures him. “You know you did. And you know that’s not the only Universe where you killed her. Or where she dies. Poor little Amy Pond. She’ll be missed.” Rory lets out a barely human howl of pain, soul deep, it may have even affected the Master, if he had a soul.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">The Master can tell the second the Universes start to pour through Rory’s mind, almost smothering him, drowning him. So many possibilities. So few of them positive. Rory is inundated with realities, with the consequences of his actions, of his inactions. At first it’s only the alternate realities of Chastity Smith which Rory witnesses. Then Rory sees all the alternative timelines after the Big Bang 2.0 as Rory’s dubbed it. His young life, not even thirty years, but still so many possibilities, more constant this time, yet still not static. Then Rory’s life before he ever met the Doctor, that is rife with alternatives. A brother who wasn’t eaten by time. A mother who never died. A father who never drank. It almost hurts the Master just to think about the vast amount of alternate realities caused during the Rory’s millennia guarding the Pandorica. Rory sees them all, all and more. He sees beyond his own years, beyond his own planet. Every single possibility and Rory knows them all.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Rory? Oh Rory?” The Master sing-songs, but Rory doesn’t respond. His eyes darting, wildly. Tears pouring from them but Rory’s face is otherwise still. The Master has finally broken him. Sure, Rory can’t tell him the whereabouts of the Doctor but that hardly matters any more. Rory is so brimming with energy, the Master uses the extraction gun, draining Rory of all that psychic excess, all that power. Rory is barely more than a shell, the Master is delighted to see. A little disappointed too. Rory put up such a fight, he’s no fun now. “You’ve served your purpose Rory.” The Master tells him. “You’re free to go.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Rory doesn’t respond.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Rory?” The Master urges, he punches Rory but Rory doesn’t even flinch. The Master unties Rory’s hands.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Rory punches the Master.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">TBC</p></lj-cut><p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"> </p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><span style=""> </span></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p></meta></meta></meta></meta>

   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light Shading Accent 3" />

   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Light List Accent 3" />

<![endif]-->  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><b style="">Fandom: </b>Sherlock<br /><b style="">Title: </b>Sex is a Drug... (1/3)<br /><b style="">Pairing: </b>Sherlock/Lestrade<br /><b style="">Rating: </b>NC-17<br /><b style="">Word Count: </b>2275<br /><b style="">Warnings: contains non-consensual sex as well as drug abuse.<o:p></o:p></b><br /><b style="">Summary: </b>Lestrade pays the price for getting in the way of a drug addict... Sherlock.<br /><b style="">Disclaimer: </b>I bet ACD is spinning in his grave. I’m so sorry. I’m sorry Moff, Gatiss, and Aunty Beeb. And Lestrade *hugs Lestrade*<br /><b style="">Author’s Note: </b>written for <lj user="sherlockbbc_fic"/>  but it morphed into a trilogy: Sex, Talk and Work.</p>                  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"> </p><lj-cut text="Sex is a Drug"><p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><b style=""><u>Sex is a Drug<o:p></o:p></u></b></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><b style=""><u><o:p><span style="text-decoration: none;"> </span></o:p></u></b></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">There were days Lestrade hated being a cop. He’d proven his investigative skills, that’s how he got to be Detective Sergeant, but it’s no longer enough. He’s investigating crimes after they’ve been committed. He feels like he’s fighting a losing battle. Especially when he’s been ordered to drop cases Lestrade actually thinks could prevent potential crimes.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">He’s only met Sherlock a few times. Completely lacking in personal skills but a brilliant mind. Thank God he’s actually using that mind to solve crimes and not commit them. Lestrade would hate to have Sherlock as an enemy, especially when, right now, he’s the closest thing to an ally he has.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">It’s a difficult task, getting hold of Sherlock’s address. He’s got a permanent storage space, Lestrade checks there first. He’s not as freaked out as he should be to find decomposing animals in the storage room, dissected animal organs preserved in jars. Lestrade understands: it’s all knowledge to Sherlock, knowledge he uses to help solve mysteries and crimes.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">What Lestrade does find disturbing is the traces of white powder that remain on the stacks of boxes and book. Not dust. Lestrade resists the urge to take a sample and send it off for analysis. It would make sense though. Sherlock’s ability to focus, his mental alertness, his energy, not mention the intense body heat Lestrade has noticed. It looks like cocaine, and the profile fits.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">It’s not Lestrade’s place to judge, no, it’s his place to uphold the law. Yet he’s in no position to arrest Sherlock, not when he’s been so helpful. Sure, he may have only helped out of boredom but still, it was help that mustn’t go unappreciated.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Lestrade sighs, feeling old beyond his years. He found his first grey hair today. He contemplates sitting down and waiting for Sherlock, it’s obvious he sleeps here on occasion, it’s only a matter of time before he returns. He should get back to the station, there’s always work to do there. He should go home, he hasn’t been home in days. He doesn’t want to go home yet.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Back to the station it is then, but not before leaving Sherlock Holmes a note. He’s very careful when tearing a page out of his notebook, but the only thing he can write with is a shard of graphite left by a broken pencil. He manages to scratch out a message anyway:</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">This was a social call, not a professional one. If I were to come here as a cop I hope I wouldn’t have to confiscate some of your belongings. You’re a good man, Mr. Holmes. I just wish you’d follow the rules more. You have to follow the law. I won’t make excuses for you.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">G Lestrade.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Lestrade leaves. Five minutes later, Sherlock strolls in and reads the note, laughing at it. Lestrade is making excuses for him. Single-minded, by-the-book, copper through and through is making excuses for him. Of course there’s no way Sherlock is going to give up his possessions, just to suit some police man’s ethics. Still, it’s an entertaining notion, one that needs to be rewarded somehow.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">****</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Lestrade returns to the storage room a couple of days later, just to check if Sherlock has stopped by. Even if he has he doesn’t expect anything to have changed. And he’s right. It’s exactly as Lestrade left it. Apart from one tell-tale sign. Lestrade’s note has been replaced, with a little gift left behind.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">I noticed that your penmanship was not up to scratch.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Lestrade laughed at that. He found it ironic, since he was having a little bit of difficulty deciphering Sherlock’s chicken scratch handwriting.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">But I shall blame the pencil, and not the man.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Shall you now?” Lestrade asks, before realising he’s talking to a note. He reads on.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">Take this pen and you should find a marked improvement. <o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">SH<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Lestrade doesn’t quite know what to make of that, not sure whether it’s an insult or a compliment, if Sherlock is mocking him or showing his appreciation. The pen is beautiful though. It reminds him when he was a child: he spent hours practising his handwriting, so worried about making a mistake he couldn’t correct. It’s a tainted memory.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Lestrade writes back, smiling because the ink flows so well.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">Thank you for the pen. You’re right, it is an improvement.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">He trails off, unwilling to make Sherlock any more smug than he already is, trying to find the balance between professional and appreciative.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">But if you really did want to do me a favour, please sort out your storage. I can’t be friends with a criminal.<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style="">G Lestrade<o:p></o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><i style=""><o:p> </o:p></i></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Lestrade pockets the pen, and leaves.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Work keeps him busy after that: looking at numerous dead bodies, murder sites merging into one another, struggling to keep the evidence straight in his head. Flittering between Vice and Homicide, working all the divisions, becoming best friends with the coroner, talking to people, learning about the victims. He’s exhausted but new cases are opened every hour.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">All his co-workers keep telling him how terrible he looks, he’s not being paid over-time, his superiors have given him strong hints that he should go home. Lestrade dismisses it. That’s more work that work, no matter how draining being a cop in London is. Lestrade doesn’t have an office yet, but he manages to find a room to crash in, just a little nap. It’s not a restful nap.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">He makes a trip to the morgue after that. There are nine bodies there at the moment. Only three of them were cases Lestrade worked on, but he was involved with all of them in a way. Everyone trusts him, they feel comfortable talking through cases with him, or even talking about their personal lives. It is easier for Lestrade to help others than it is to help himself.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Easier to help the dead. The dead never thank him.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Hey Sid.” Lestrade greets the coroner with a cup of coffee. Sid looks just as exhausted as he feels. “How are you coping?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I’m telling you Lestrade, must be a full moon. The population of London is dropping like flies.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“How’s Bones coming along?” Lestrade asks. He sat with a woman or over an hour, talking, calming her down. She was so scared because the recent rains had uncovered a mass of bones in her garden.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Human, male, died in his late teens or early twenties.” Sid recites. “I don’t think you’ll have much luck with this one. He’s been dead at least fifty years.” Lestrade sighs. “You okay?” Lestrade rubs his eyes, belatedly answering.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Yeah I’m fine. The skull is intact.” Lestrade notes. “I never noticed that before.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Yes. It’s a miracle, really.” Sid replies. “If I never see a jigsaw puzzle again it will be too soon.” Sid smiles. Lestrade doesn’t. “What’s wrong?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Nothing.” Lestrade insists. “I must be *really* tired. What will happen to the bones?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“What are you thinking?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“That the skull would make a nice gift for a ... person I know. And now I’ve got visions of him grave robbing.” Lestrade complains.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Sounds like you better give him the skull.” Sid does his best not to giggle.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Can I do that?” Lestrade questions. “I’m sure it’s against the law, somehow...” Lestrade frowns in confusion, his mind foggy.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Go home Sergeant. Or give this to your friend.” Sid places the skull in Lestrade’s hands. “I’m not giving you another option.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“What about the other bodies?” Lestrade asks.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“They’re dead. They can wait.” Sid replies. “Now run along. I’ve got work to do, and you haven’t.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“And to think, I brought you coffee.” Lestrade mutters under his breath on his way out.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">***</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Lestrade is beyond exhausted when he shows up at the storage place. It’s been left open. At first Lestrade is worried he has a burglary to investigate, especially when he looks inside to see that most of Sherlock’s more unsavoury belongings have gone.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Do you like what I’ve done with the place?” Sherlock asks with a wide smile on his face. Lestrade can see the traces of wide powder on Sherlock’s nose. He feels sick. He wants to leave but Sherlock’s hand grabs his arm. “Don’t go. I did this for you.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“You shouldn’t have.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“But you asked me to!” Sherlock frowns, upset.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Let me go, Sherlock.” Lestrade commands, but the weariness is evident in his voice. “I’m not going to have this conversation with you whilst you’re high.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“No!” Sherlock calls out. “Stay. Sit down.” Sherlock’s grip is painful on Lestrade’s arm, guiding him to a stack of books and dragging him down, forcing him to sit. “What’s that?” Sherlock asks, seeing the bulge in the pocket of Lestrade’s long coat. Lestrade pulls the skull out of his pocket and hands it to Sherlock, somewhat despondently.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I thought you might like it.” Lestrade admits in a quiet voice, not looking Sherlock in the eyes. Sherlock misinterprets it as shyness, he doesn’t realise Lestrade is weak, tired and afraid. Lestrade has been in this position before, even if he can’t recall it. Lestrade is too tired to fight or run so his mind is withdrawing. Sherlock doesn’t notice. He takes the skull from Lestrade’s hands eagerly.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Thank you.” Sherlock moves in to kiss Lestrade only to be angered when Lestrade turns his head away. Lestrade winces, knowing it was a mistake but it was instinctual. “You came to ME!”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Not for this.” Lestrade manages to calmly say, trying not to cry. He hasn’t cried in years. This time Sherlock wraps a hand around Lestrade’s neck as he kisses him on the mouth. Sherlock can taste the silent tears. They make him desperate for more. “Sherlock, don’t.” Lestrade implores.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Fine then.” Sherlock sulks, pulling away. “You’re free to go.” Lestrade looks at him, confused and hopeful. His body is sluggish but he’s eventually able to stand and he starts walking to the door. His hand is reaching for the handle when Sherlock presses up against his back. “You are such a fucking tease.” Sherlock says hotly into Lestrade’s ear. Lestrade scolds himself for being so foolish.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Sherlock, please...” Lestrade cries.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Please what?” Sherlock asks, his eyes wild and dilated. “Please kiss you, suck you, fuck you?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“No.” Lestrade gasps. “Please don’t.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“I’m sick of this game we’ve been playing.” Sherlock tells Lestrade, his hands tugging at Lestrade’s shirt, pulling it out of his trousers. He unbuckles Lestrade’s belt, undoes his flies and lets the trousers fall to the floor. He pulls down the Sergeant’s skivvies and grasps his cock, painful enough to make Lestrade cry out in pain. “Dancing round each other for weeks. Fuck!” Lestrade can feel Sherlock’s erection through Sherlock’s trousers, grinding against him.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“You’re just high. You’re not thinking straight. If you were thinking straight, you wouldn’t want this Sherlock. You don’t want this. You know you don’t and you know I don’t. Sherlock, please-“ Lestrade rants, his last attempt to talk Sherlock out of it before he withdraws completely.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“The drugs make me smarter, they make things clearer.” Sherlock corrects him. “This tension has been growing between us for weeks. I was foolish to let it go on for so long. Oh the times I spent, jerking off to thoughts of you, it’s becoming unbearable.” Sherlock scrambles at his own flies, so eager, so desperate. He shoves his underwear down. His cock is already leaking, it feels like he’s been hard ever since he sniffed those couple of lines of coke, and that must have been at least forty-five minutes ago. “Relax.” Sherlock instructs Lestrade, unable to hear Lestrade’s shuddering breath under Sherlock’s blood pounding in his ears. Such a rush!</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Sherlock realises that he can’t take Lestrade like this, so he sucks on one of his fingers first. He doesn’t do a great job of preparation, but Sherlock feels invincible, he’s sure it will be adequate. And it does feel a little easier as he pushes into Lestrade, Lestrade isn’t resisting, he’s given up his ridiculous protests, Sherlock is far too smart for them.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Lestrade feels helpless, he can’t even prevent the tears which are falling from his eyes. He keeps telling himself that it’s the drugs. He *knows* it’s the drugs. This is his own fault. He should have confiscated the drugs when he had the chance. This is his fault for not following the law, of course he must be punished. Sherlock doesn’t know what he’s doing, he’s off his head. Sherlock isn’t a dangerous man. It’s Lestrade’s fault for getting in the way. Again.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">It hurts but Lestrade feels numb, exhaustion dulling the pain but he can’t stop the occasional whimper from leaving his lips. At least the blood is providing some lubrication, but that just means Sherlock pumps harder. Lestrade feels dizzy, he even tries to warn Sherlock but he collapses before the words have the chance to come out. Sherlock barely notices. With the cocaine rushing though his system, Sherlock drags Lestrade to the middle of the room and fucks him on the floor there.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Sherlock works hard for his climax, energetic and enthusiastic, buzzing on the drugs he pounds away, his perception distorted. He comes with a primal shout, barely human because that’s how he feels now, the cocaine elevating him beyond human status.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">He cleans himself with oily rags and redresses. The drugs are wearing off but he’s still coming down from the high of the orgasm. Without that he wouldn’t be functioning right now. He steps over Lestrade’s bleeding, unconscious body and out into the seedy world of London. He needs to buy more cocaine.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">TBC</p></lj-cut><p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"> </p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p></meta></meta></meta></meta>
