<![endif]-->  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><b style="">Fandom: </b>Doctor Who<br /><b style="">Title: </b>Torture (05/09ish)<br /><b style="">Characters: </b>Rory and a new incarnation of The Master<br /><b style="">Rating: </b>NC-17, very violent and dark.<br /><b style="">Warning: </b>This series includes death, mutilation and torture. Physical, mental, and now sexual torture.<br /><b style="">Word Count: </b>1380<br /><b style="">Summary: </b>The Master’s torture takes a different turn in his effort to break Rory.<br /><b style="">Disclaimer: </b>I really don’t own Doctor Who, this isn’t for profit.<br /><b style="">Author’s Notes: </b>written for <lj comm="eleventy_kink"/> . <br /><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/70107.html">part one</a><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/70147.html">part two</a><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/70551.html">part three</a><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/71003.html">part four</a><o:p></o:p></p>                    <lj-cut text="Torture 05"><p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><b style=""><u>Torture<o:p></o:p></u></b></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><b style=""><u><o:p><span style="text-decoration: none;"> </span></o:p></u></b></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">The pain is so intense that Rory is on the verge of passing out. But what hurts the most is the fact he feels like he’s betrayed Amy. Rory tugs on his restraints, trying to warn the Master that he better not lay a finger on his wife but the Master doesn’t feel threatened. No. He finally feels as though he’s got the upper-hand.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Amelia Pond.” The Master snarls. “Did you really think you could keep her from me?” Rory had hoped. “She fixed the Universe. She’s special. Whatever made you think she would settle for being your wife?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">‘She loves me’ Rory thinks, a little shakily. It’s another mantra Rory has had to adopt to survive. Another mantra the Master can twist until it breaks.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“She loves the Doctor.” The Master tells him, gleefully. “Everybody does.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">‘That means I must too.’ Rory retorts. ‘So I won’t betray him. I won’t let you know anything that could hurt the Doctor, the TARDIS or Amy.’ Rory thinks defiantly, despite the vast amount of pain he’s in, his body shaking, sweating.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Still so defiant!” The Master muses out loud. “Perhaps you’re not in enough pain.” There are bugs inside Rory’s head, amplifying his brainwaves, simultaneously stimulating all the pain receptors in his body. Then there’s the psychomanipulator and extraction gun the Master has used on him, it should have turned his brain to mush, yet his mind is still intact and stronger than ever. There’s Rory’s black eye, bloodied nose clogging his nostrils and the rope tearing at the corners off his mouth, making it difficult to breathe. There’s Rory’s broken finger and the rope twisting and digging and burning into his wrists. Still, just to be thorough, the Master digs his bare fingers into Rory’s stomach wound and pulls out a fragmented piece of bullet.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Rory passes out.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Fuck!” The Master curses. Not that he’s surprised. Rory’s tolerance for pain has far exceeded most of the other individuals the Master has had the pleasure of torturing. No. The Master is frustrated. Rory hasn’t responded to physical torture, he even took the bullet to save a stranger. Rory somehow even managed to block the mental torture, even when the Master went directly to his brain. The Master almost doesn’t know what to try next.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">He has a chance to tinker around his little studio, work on some of his inventions. He will find a way off this rock, to some more enlightened time and Rory is the key, he’s certain of that. Such a fascinating boy, the Master can’t define him: Millennia spent devoted to the Doctor and his wife. Rory is more human than human. The Master is determined to break him, because, oh, he’ll be so beautiful once he’s broken.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">The Master’s eye is drawn to Rory’s bloodied wedding ring: Metal from another planet, another time; A symbol of love, of commitment, with the potential to bind people until their death. Powerful stuff. The Master likes power.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Rory wakes up. Pain creeping in, his brain feeling as though it’s pulsating, alive but dying. He’s not afraid. At least, not until he can feel the Master’s hands undoing the flies of his trousers. The Master doesn’t need to be able to read Rory’s mind to know what Rory is thinking. Still, he takes delight in the confusion, horror and fear he finds in there.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Don’t worry.” The Master whispers into Rory’s ear, taking care to make him worry more. “I just thought you’ve been tied up to this chair for... a while.” The Master is careful not to let Rory know how long since Rory has lost all sense of time, all his senses overridden with pain. “I thought you might like to... relieve yourself.” The Master smiles sinisterly, gently easing Rory’s penis out of his boxers, pointing it at the dusty floor. There’s so much adrenaline and so little moisture left in his body that Rory is barely able to pee, so little of the tea he drank with Chastity left in his system. He hoped, if he managed to pee, that the Master would just tuck him away and that would be the end of it. Of course it isn’t.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Such a shy boy, aren’t you?” The Master croons and Rory refuses to think of an answer. His head hurts so much, he’s too tired and too pained to try to guess what the Master is trying to achieve. “How long were you in love with Amy before you were able to even talk to her, tell her?” Rory tries so hard not to think of Amy, but he can’t help it. He thinks of the years, friends since childhood, he’s loved her since he was a child, since before he knew about sex. He thinks of the ache in his heart, the butterflies in his stomach. He’s always felt that way about Amy. He’s just never been too sure about the way she felt about him.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Now, now, stop thinking like that.” The Master says. “Think about her. About how attractive she is. Because, oh, she is.” Rory is barely aware of anything apart from the pain but Rory can still feel the Master’s hand on his dick, gently squeezing. “Come on Rory Williams, this could be fun for you.” The Master’s hand starts to pump more fiercely. “Think about her red hair, the first time you made love to her, the way she smelled. Your wedding night.” Rory’s dick is limp in the Master’s hand, so the Master squeezes hard. “You’re no fun.” The Master lets Rory go.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Now, Amy Pond, she’s a fun girl.” The Master continues as Rory curses, he suddenly sees where this is going. He fights against his restraints but he’s too weak and the twine is too strong. “So adventurous. In bed, too. A wild thing.” Rory looks away as he sees the Master stroking himself through his trousers, becoming erect at the thought of Amy, at Rory’s thoughts of Amy.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Rory’s eyes are shut tight but he can still hear the Master’s trousers fall to the ground softly. He hears the sounds of flesh on flesh, the Master’s gasps. He can feel the Master’s breath, so close to him, panting hot and heavy. Rory is crying, desperately trying not to think of Amy but he can’t control the thoughts running through his head. The slight curve of her breast, the pale white skin, her inner thighs. He thinks of their wedding day, their honeymoon. All the time he can feel the Master jerking off to those thoughts, the images in his mind flashing, quicker and quicker until he can feel the Master’s come landing on Rory’s bare thigh. Rory’s throat contracts as bile rises, soaking the rope around his throat. His eyes are bleeding. His mind begins to feel numb.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Oh Rory, this is delightful.” The Master exclaims. “You put up such a good fight. I haven’t had this much fun since Jack.” Rory winces as he sees a man, bound by chains, being killed again and again. Captain Jack Harkness, the TARDIS told him before. Rory knows he’s never met the man, yet he can feel the Master’s delight at watching Jack fight against the chains, burning him, cutting him, raping him. He remembers it as if he was there but he knows he wasn’t, he wouldn’t do such a thing. He can’t be certain of anything any more. “I know.” The Master smiles, because he does know, the state of Rory’s mind, a muddle. “Why don’t you tell me where the TARDIS is?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">‘I don’t know.’ Rory replies. He can no longer feel her presence. He can’t feel Amy’s presence either. He always knows where she is. She’s with the Doctor, but the Doctor is usually near his TARDIS and Rory can’t tell, he can’t think. ‘I know what you’ve done. What you want. Who you’re willing to burn to get it.’ Rory challenges. He remembers Chastity and the newborn girl, and somehow sheds another tear. ‘I don’t know what you want from me, but I won’t let you get it.’ Rory thinks weakly. ‘Over my dead body.’ Rory looks down, to his stomach which is coated in drying blood. ‘Should be very soon now.’ Rory passes out.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">TBC</p></lj-cut><p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"> </p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p></meta></meta></meta></meta>

<![endif]-->  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><b style="">Fandom: </b>Sherlock<br /><b style="">Title: </b>Sweet Dreams<br /><b style="">Rating: </b>R. Mostly for <b style="">surrealism</b> but there’s also a brief couple of sentences about the <b style="">murdering and butchering of children.<o:p></o:p></b><br /><b style="">Summary: </b>Sherlock watches <i style="">In the Night Garden<o:p></o:p></i><br /><b style="">Word Count: </b>865<br /><b style="">Disclaimer: </b>I don’t own Sherlock, or Sherlock Holmes, or In the Night Garden. And I heartily disclaim this fic. *shudders*<br /><b style="">Author’s Note: </b>written for a prompt at <lj user="sherlockbbc_fic"/>  but it took a rather sinister turn. I sincerely apologise.</p>              <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><u><o:p></o:p></u><u><o:p></o:p></u> </p>    <lj-cut text="Sweet Dreams"><p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><b style=""><u>Sweet Dreams <o:p></o:p></u></b></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Sherlock was BORED! Trouble was... he was actually kind of tired too. Possibly too tired to sleep but far too exhausted to actually DO something. John was asleep, as was Mrs. Hudson. Lestrade might not be awake, but he’s too far away to pester. Sherlock can’t quite decide if that’s personal growth or just laziness for him.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Either way, he decides to attempt what other people do, which is to stare at the television mindlessly until it lulls them to sleep.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">He stumbles to the living room, carrying his duvet with him, he curls up on the chair and settles down to watch some late night/early morning TV.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">There’s porn, which Sherlock quickly skips. There’s dozens of shopping channels, and perhaps it’s the insomnia talking, but Sherlock is actually tempted. Then he reminds himself that John might actually kill him if he cluttered up the house any more. Sherlock may be a sociopath but John is a designated killer, and he wouldn’t put it past Lestrade to cover it up either. Sherlock changes the channel.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Children’s shows. Sherlock has no desire to watch a cartoon about a red dog who is the size of a house, so he quickly moves on. Men in weird costumes that have a telly in their stomach as well as a baby’s face in the place of the sun? Sherlock frowns and switches it over. Sherlock wouldn’t even have watched that when he was high on morphine. Next there’s a show complete with crazily addictive songs that Sherlock curses in anticipation of the horror he’ll feel when he finds himself humming it in front of John tomorrow. A little girl, dressed in far too much pink, is dancing with humanoid puppets in a world that is warped and wonky. Sherlock shudders and switches the channel over.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Another children’s programme, but this one looks more promising. Sure, it makes little sense, but Sherlock is able to deduce that it is a dream world. Sherlock can’t quite tell if it’s the dream of a small child or if it is the dream of the blue creature called ‘Igglepiggle’ but it really doesn’t matter. What does matter is that there’s a soothing voice and it’s carrying him off to sleep.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Sherlock finds himself carried away on a tiny little boat, with only a blue blanket for a sail. The sea is rough and he’s feeling rather sick because of the swaying and sloshing. There’s too much water getting into the boat, the strong winds snap the sail and soon Sherlock is struggling to keep his head above the water. He’s choking, spluttering on the sea water when he washes up on an island.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">The island is far too green for his liking. It should be setting off his hay fever but it isn’t. Sherlock doesn’t have time to question it though, as a Pinky Ponk comes thundering down, so loud and large and it shifts before his very eyes, growing guns that try to shoot him down. Sherlock watches, horrified, as the grass is blown up, leaving plasticine holes in its wake. Sherlock runs for shelter.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">He sees a house, full of tiny little creatures, and they start climbing up his leg. He shrugs them off but they keep climbing, up to his chest, clinging to his neck. Sherlock makes sure to keep his mouth shut but he’s terrified they’ll crawl in elsewhere, they’re so tiny.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">Sherlock runs, unable to look ahead because he’s too distracted by the miniature people who are tugging on his hair. He bumps into a giant rubber building. When he falls flat on the grass, he realises he’s squished the tiny people, the Pontipines. He looks up, to see that the building is alive; it has eyes, despite being so huge. Sherlock brushes the lifeless corpses from his hair, and keeps on running.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">He runs underground, to some kind of liar. There he finds axe-wielding cheerful triplets, humming as they are busy cutting up the bodies of small children, children who have travelled to their garden. Macca Pacca is cleaning up the bloody mess with his ‘agga pang’, before drying it off with his ‘uff-uff’. Sherlock decided he better keep on running. There must be someplace safe in this garden.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">He runs into a rag doll, knocking her to the floor.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Upsy Daisy.” She says, before proceeding to KISS him. He tries to push her off but she’s bigger than him, and he’s exhausted. So he calls out as she keeps kissing him, crushing him, HUGGING him!</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Sherlock!” Oh thank goodness, that’s John’s voice. But he sounds so far away. “Sherlock, wake up!” Sherlock wakes up when John pours ice cold water over him.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Careful of the chair!” Sherlock scolds him.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“You were having a nightmare.” John explains. “What the hell were you dreaming about?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Nothing.” Sherlock says, a little too quickly. He switches off the TV, which is just giving off static.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“You okay?” john questions, carefully.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">“Fine.” Comes Sherlock’s clipped reply. “I’m going to bed.” Sherlock tells him, and he goes, dragging his duvet behind him. He snuggles up in bed, but as he begins to dream, he returns to the Garden of Nightmares.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;">FIN</p></lj-cut><p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"> </p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing" style="text-align: justify;"><o:p> </o:p></p></meta></meta></meta></meta>

A Sherlock vidlet. Contains unrequited Molly/Sherlock, Molly/Jim and possibly implied Sherlock/John. An alternative look at Molly's story arc with a twist on the season finale. Some bunnies need to be vidded. Hope you enjoy it. Youtube muted the soundtrack so I had to upload it to vimeo :-(

<![endif]-->  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style="">Fandom: </b>Doctor Who<br /><b style="">Title: </b>Torture (04/10ish)<br /><b style="">Characters: </b>Rory and a new incarnation of The Master<br /><b style="">Rating: </b>NC-17, very violent and dark.<br /><b style="">Warning: </b>This series includes death, mutilation and mental torture<br /><b style="">Word Count: </b>1350<b style=""><o:p></o:p></b><br /><b style="">Summary: </b>Rory is still resisting, so the Master tries to access Rory’s memories more directly<br /><b style="">Disclaimer: </b>I really don’t own Doctor Who, this isn’t for profit.<br /><b style="">Timeline: </b>Takes place after Matt Smith’s first season as Doctor and it does include spoilers for that season. This is also influenced by the Big Finish audio play ‘Master’ so it contains spoilers for that too... ish<br /><b style="">Author’s Notes: </b>written for <lj comm="eleventy_kink"/> . <br /><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/70107.html">part one</a><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/70147.html">part two</a><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/70551.html">part three</a><o:p></o:p></p>                      <lj-cut text="Torture (04/10)"><p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style=""><u>Torture<o:p></o:p></u></b></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style=""><u><o:p><span style="text-decoration: none;"> </span></o:p></u></b></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">The pain is excruciating. Rory is long past the point of being able to cry, thirsty and dehydrated but not broken. The Master is almost impressed but he is mostly frustrated. Rory should be begging him, pleading to let him help. Rory should be worshiping the Master by now, submitting to him, serving him.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">If there’s one thing the Master knows it is how pathetic people are. Not just humans, although the Master hates humans in particular, they look so much like his own race. That’s an issue for another time, hopefully the Master will have plenty of it to mess around with soon. The Master growls with frustration. It’s frustrating being inside Rory’s head. So many thoughts, whizzing about, so strong and loud, so consistent, rhythmic and it sounds just as bad as the drums. Yet Rory doesn’t seem angry about them, nor have they driven him crazy. No. Rory seems to be clinging to his thoughts, repetitive mantras and facts and thoughts and so long as he has those, his spirit will never be broken.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">Rory is different.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">Whilst every individual the Master has had the pleasure of manipulating has thought about themselves; about how much pain they’re in, about how they hope they won’t die, how this is so unfair to them... Rory is unique. He’s so selfless it’s sickening. Even now, even enduring agony, Rory still hopes the Doctor doesn’t come for him. He’s willing to sacrifice himself for something he doesn’t even understand.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“What the fuck is wrong with you?” The Master loses his temper. He finds Rory confusing, baffling, and the Master does not enjoy it. Rory can’t answer, not verbally, still choking on the rope which is slick with spit and vomit and blood. He makes sure to think his response though, loud and clear.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">‘Well, at the moment I’m being tortured by a mad man. That’s what’s wrong with me. What’s wrong with you, to make you want to torture me?’</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Hey, I ask the questions.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">‘Sorry.’ Rory apologises. ‘Why do you do it though?’ Rory asks, his tone curious and oddly calm. ‘Do you even know? Fair enough, not everybody knows their purpose in life-‘</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“My purpose is to make the Doctor suffer.” The Master declares.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">‘He’s your friend. The only friend you’ve got.’</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“He sold me out!”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">‘That’s not an excuse, Koschei.’ Rory tries to tell him. ‘He regrets that.’</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“My people don’t.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">‘Your people are dead.’ Rory states simply. No malice in his thoughts. Just a simple plea. ‘Isn’t it time for you to move on? For you and the Doctor to work together? Isn’t it lonely being so selfish?’</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Fuck you Rory Williams.” The Master snaps, before regaining his composure. Rory seems to have a way of getting under his skin. It’s unsettling. Yet he can’t bring himself to kill him. “You’ve seen the Doctor, he’s just as crazy as me but the difference between us is that he cares.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">‘But you do care. If you didn’t you wouldn’t put in all this effort. You would have killed me by now.’</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“No, because you want that.” The Master realises. “You know I’ll make you talk. You know you’re not that strong and you’re terrified of betraying the Doctor.” The Master smirks. “It hurts you, to think of how I’ll make him suffer, how I’ll enjoy it. Because you care! So weak.” Rory agrees. Such a low self-esteem. Almost no perception of himself. The Master has delved into his thoughts and he still knows so little about Rory.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I’m sick of you playing head shrink. My turn!” The Master declares gleefully. “So, what was your childhood like?” Rory tries so hard not to think about it, but he can’t help it. Still, Rory’s thoughts are confusing: A childhood of disappearing adults, of always being responsible for an alcoholic father, of a brother that was no longer there and a friend, the only constant.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“And growing up? That’s always a bitch.” The Master comments, but Rory was born a grown up. Not literally of course, but with the mind of an adult. Especially the second time round. So sensible and content. It’s hard to imagine him getting caught up in the Doctor’s crazy antics.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“And what about the Doctor? Where do you fit in with him?” The Master listens intently, but still feels like he’s watching an edited version. Rory’s not really sure why the Doctor chose him. Something about childhood encounters and always feeling inadequate. A child trying to live up legend of a Time Lord. The Master knows how it feels to be in the Doctor’s shadow, he’s grown to despise the Doctor for it. Rory is in awe of him. Rory wants to be him, to be what he thinks the Doctor is: a healer. That’s why it’s so easy Rory him to sacrifice himself. Such faith in others: such thoughtlessness for himself. The Master can work on that.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Don’t you ever get tired of it?” The Master questions. “Being good? Caring for others? Getting treated like shit for it?” As a Nurse he wasn’t shown the respect other Doctor’s received. Rory didn’t do it for respect. He did it to help others. “You can’t save everybody.” Rory is acutely aware of this, painfully thinking of Chastity and the newborn girl. He remembers the others who died. He pictures their names and faces. Every single one a fully-fledged person in Rory’s mind. All of them. From his career as a Nurse, to those he saw on the news, to those who died during his travels with the Doctor.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">Death follows the Doctor around. Perhaps he is Her Champion after all. The Master never understood why the Doctor had such loyal subjects when they all met such lousy fates. At least the Master will stab you in the front. He’ll stab Rory in the front. After he’s broken him. It’s proving to be challenge though. Rory doesn’t seem scared of Death, not if it ensures the survival of the Doctor. In fact, The Master tilts his head as he realises, Rory has died for the Doctor before. He’s willing to do so again. And he will, once the Master is bored. He’s frustrated, but not bored. Rory’s death will be a well-earned prize for the Master. A punishment for the Doctor.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Just think,” The Master snarls. “You’ll get to die twice for him. That’s a new one, even for the Doctor.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">‘It’s the least I can do.’ Rory thinks and it makes the Master scoff.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“What are you, Rory Williams?” The Master asks, repeatedly. “You died. You lived. So many memories. It’s intoxicating.” The Master allows them to flow over him, the years, the time. But still, something is being blocked. “2000 years spend guarding the Pandorica. What was in it?” Rory swears that he doesn’t know, just that it was important. The Master looks back on Rory’s memories, his childhood friend, the constant, she’s there but the Master can’t focus on her. Rory is blocking him.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“You think you can hide anything from me?” The Master is outraged. “Now I’ll ask you nicely, what are you keeping from me?” Rory refuses to think. He shouldn’t be able to do that. “I can hurt you!” The Master promises. The parasites in Rory’s brain contract and remind him just how much pain he’s in. Rory concentrates on that, refusing to think, just feeling. The Master can feel Rory’s love and admiration, not just for the Doctor but...</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">Of course! The Master could kick himself for being such an idiot. But he’d much rather kick Rory. Rory is wearing a wedding ring. Yet there are no memories of his wife. Rory is trying to protect her. He’s doing a good job of it too. No problem, just means the Master will have to pull out the big guns.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“A psychomanipulator and extraction gun.” The Master announces, showing Rory his makeshift tool. “May cause permanent brain damage, but I’m fine with that.” The Master switches on the tool, the sound similar to the Doctor’s screwdriver but much, much more menacing. The pain is excruciating. Rory is incapable of thinking, of breathing, the agony is that intense. And if the mind probe wasn’t enough, the Master breaks Rory’s finger as he snaps off his wedding ring.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">The Master learns all about Amy Pond.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">TBC</p></lj-cut>    <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p></o:p><o:p></o:p><o:p></o:p></p></meta></meta></meta></meta>

<![endif]-->  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style="">Fandom: </b>Sherlock<br /><b style="">Title: </b>Too Close<br /><b style="">Rating: </b>PG-13 for owchies and emotion<br /><b style="">Characters: </b>Lestrade, Sherlock, John<br /><b style="">Summary: </b>a post-ep fic for the 01x03 finale so spoilers for that episode. If you haven’t seen it, this fic will make little sense.<br /><b style="">Word count: </b>500<br /><b style="">Disclaimer: </b>I’m just a penniless Sherlock fan writing fanfiction.<br /><b style="">Author’s Notes: </b>written for <lj user="sherlockbbc_fic"/>  after someone asked for what happens next. This was written at 2am and although I’ve revisited it since, concrit is very much appreciated.</p>                <p class="MsoNormal"><b><u><o:p><span style="text-decoration: none;"> </span></o:p></u></b></p>  <p class="MsoNormal"><lj-cut text="Too Close"><b><u>Too Close</u> </b><br /> <br /> Lestrade watches over John's lifeless body. Sherlock's hands gripping John's, careful of the IV drip. Sherlock is talking continuously, words far too fast for Lestrade to comprehend, barely taking a breath. It's not until a full minute has passed that Lestrade realises Sherlock is talking to him.<br /> <br /> "He was too close. I knew he was too close to the explosives. I was nearer the swimming pool. I was the one with the gun. I knew when to dive. I thought he knew, I thought he knew what I had planned. I must have miscalculated. The distance between us must have been further than I thought. I don't understand. I mean, I do, understand, but it's just not fair. I shouldn't be fine, I don't *feel* fine-"<br /> <br /> "You're not fine!" Lestrade interrupts. "You have burns over 20% of your body, broken ribs, you're in shock."<br /> <br /> "The water from the swimming pool protected me." Sherlock dismisses. "John had no such protection." Sherlock is confused as he feels the moisture on his cheek. Possibly a side affect of the medication he was given. "He should be dead." Sherlock admits softly. "You are certain Moriarty is dead?"<br /> <br /> "We recovered his remains." Lestrade assures him. "He's nothing but bones and ashes. You won."<br /> <br /> "It's not a game." Sherlock tells him. "And even if it is, there are always more players. Not usually such dangerous ones-"<br /> <br /> "You made the right decision, Sherlock." Lestrade says.<br /> <br /> "I know. Of course I made the right decision. He had to be stopped." Sherlock states. <br /> <br /> "Sherlock, you should go back to your room." Lestrade sighs. "You haven't been discharged yet. You need to rest, recuperate. I can stay with Watson. I'll wake you up, if there's any change."<br /> <br /> "You think I can sleep?" Sherlock asks, outraged. "Now?"<br /> <br /> "I think you *need* sleep." Lestrade states. "You've been watching over him for fifty hours straight. It's not healthy. I'm sure one of the nurses could give you some drugs, to help you sleep."<br /> <br /> "I don't need drugs, I need-" Sherlock cuts himself off, but Lestrade can tell by the tight grip he has on Watson's hand what he means. Lestrade doesn't know what to say. Luckily, Lestrade does not have to say anything.<br /> <br /> "Sherlock?" John whispers, his voice the weakest of croaks. "What happened?" Lestrade answers, since Sherlock is too overwhelmed to speak.<br /> <br /> "You guys killed Moriarty. You're a hero, John Watson." Lestrade informs him. "But next time leave the explosive handling to us. We can't afford to lose our best crime-fighting mind." Because Lestrade doesn't doubt it: if John lost his life, Sherlock would lose his mind.<br /> <br /> "It was too close." Sherlock chokes out, the moisture pouring from his eyes now. "Too close." Lestrade leaves the two men alone, John already falling asleep, Sherlock still clinging to John's hand. Sherlock's head comes to rest on John's bed, and he finally drifts off to sleep, safe in the knowledge that John is near by.<br /> <br /> FIN</lj-cut></p></meta></meta></meta></meta>

<![endif]-->  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style="">Fandom: </b>Doctor Who<br /><b style="">Title: </b>Torture (03/10ish)<br /><b style="">Characters: </b>Rory and a new incarnation of The Master<br /><b style="">Rating: </b>NC-17, very violent and dark.<br /><b style="">Warning: </b>This series includes death, mutilation and mental torture<br /><b style="">Word Count: </b>1250<b style=""><o:p></o:p></b><br /><b style="">Summary: </b>Rory tries not to think about the Doctor, but the Master has ways of making him think.<br /><b style="">Disclaimer: </b>I really don’t own Doctor Who, this isn’t for profit.<br /><b style="">Timeline: </b>Takes place after Matt Smith’s first season as Doctor and it does include spoilers for that season. This is also influenced by the Big Finish audio play ‘Master’ so it contains spoilers for that too. But kind of incorporates the John Simm!Master back story too... so yeah<br /><b style="">Author’s Notes: </b>written for <lj comm="eleventy_kink"/> . This is getting kind of Meta. I enjoy implying things. If there’s anything you think is a reference which you don’t quite understand, feel free to ask. (sorry this is taking so long. RL is a bitch, and it keeps having puppies)<br /><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/70107.html">part one</a><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/70147.html">part two</a></p>                    <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"> </p><lj-cut text="part three"><p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style=""><u>Torture<o:p></o:p></u></b></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style=""><u><o:p><span style="text-decoration: none;"> </span></o:p></u></b></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I am your Master!” The man declares, angry that Rory’s first instinct is to laugh. “How dare you laugh at me?!” The Master tightens the rope which is around Rory’s neck.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I’m laughing at myself, you idiot!” Rory bites back and the Master is so shocked he loses his grip on the rope. He’s impressed, confused, and more than a little intrigued. “If you’d given me a few more seconds I could have figured it out. I’ve read all about you. I know who you are.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“You’ve heard about me?” The Master is thrilled.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I know all about you... Koschei.” Rory tells him. “I know you’re a Time Lord, I know what your race did to you. I know what happened between you, and the Doctor. When you were children. Why he feels responsible for you. I almost understand.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“DON’T YOU DARE SHOW ME PITY!!!!!”<b style=""> </b>The Master screams, which in retrospect was a foolish thing to do because it makes Rory feel even more sympathy for the man. He still hates the Master for his actions, for the senseless murder, but it’s true. Rory does understand. The Master is ‘Death’s Champion’. That doesn’t mean Rory has to like it.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I don’t pity you.” Rory replies calmly. “I don’t pity the Doctor either. I understand why he doesn’t kill you. I even understand why he loves you. I don’t think he believes the whole ‘sole survivor of his race’ thing. He can’t be that naive, can he?” The Master gives him a look which implies the Doctor really could be that naive. “Well that’s kind of sweet.” Rory smiles fondly, before a look of sorrow passes across his features. “Me, not so much.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“You reckon you could kill me?” The Master laughs and for once Rory regrets being human. He could really use a gun instead of a hand right now. Not that it would do any good tied behind his back. “You don’t want to kill me.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I don’t want to.” Rory admits. “But I could. I would, given half the chance.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Maybe there’s hope for you after all.” The Master smiles and it makes Rory shiver to gain the Master’s approval. <span style=""> </span>“Does the Doctor know you’ve been reading his diary?”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I haven’t.” Rory replies, the loss of blood from his stomach loosening his tongue. “I’ve been reading the TARDIS’”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“You’ve talked to her?” The Master is astonished. “She’s shown you? She’s been inside your head?”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Koschei, you’re evil, not stupid.” Rory says, uncharacteristically for him. “I’m not a Time Lord. I’m a human being.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Your mind isn’t.” The Master sniffs Rory’s forehead. “I can feel the knowledge pulsing in your blood, but it doesn’t feel like blood, doesn’t even taste like blood,” The Master licks at the scab forming on the corner of Rory’s mouth. “It tastes like Time!” The Master moans ecstatically. “Oh how I’ve missed Time, travelling through it in a linear fashion is SO unbearable!” Rory flinches at that. It was his choice. He bore it very well. “Rory, what is your secret?”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“It’s weird.” Rory comments. “The TARDIS. She feels so like home. After... things, after the whole universe changed without me knowing, after having her crash into my life, it was like I was already the happiest man alive and then she came back without me ever knowing I was ever missing her and she made it even better. She was my safe space, she looked after me. There’s a spot, in the library. Time moves so slow there. The Doctor wouldn’t miss me. It took me a week of reading before I figured out it was a time dilation field that she set up for me. Another week before she trusted me with the volume about you.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“A chapter about you, a profile of your personality; a chapter about your relationship with the Doctor; a chapter about the atrocities you have committed, the people you have used and destroyed; then there was the chapter... everything else was just numbers, a list of twisted actions that I couldn’t comprehend but this was told first person. She told me how you raped her, the TARDIS. She told me how you ripped out her insides and replaced it with your own hatred. How you’ve sabotaged her. Forced her to trap the Doctor. Every single thing you’ve done to her, over the many many years. If you think I am going to lead you to her, or the Doctor, you’re wrong! I will never! I won’t let you touch them!!!”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“You can’t protect them!” There’s panic in the Master’s voice, because Rory sounds so determined. ‘That’s okay’ the Master tells himself. ‘It will make it even more delicious when I break him’. He’s never met a person who couldn’t be broken. He’s even managed to break the Doctor before his annoying companions got the world to put him back together. Rory Williams is alone though. That’s when the Master notices Rory’s wedding ring for the first time. “You’ve been keeping secrets from me!!!” The Master’s hand caresses the ring and Rory can feel the bile rising in his throat. “This won’t work if you keep secrets from me.” The Master adds, this time softly, almost lovingly.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I won’t talk.” Rory assures him. “I won’t tell you anything that could hurt them!”<span style="">  </span></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“You don’t have to talk!” The Master replies, making sure to gag Rory’s mouth tight, opening up the scab on Rory’s lip, blood soaking the rope. “But you will tell me everything I want to know.” The Master pulls away, almost reluctantly. He reaches for a jar and uses some pliers to pull out the ingredients. “You see this? It’s a bug, found naturally on this planet.” Rory can see where this is going, but he can’t resist the chance to taunt, feeling uncharacteristically cocky. “THIS IS NOTHING LIKE STAR TREK!!!” The Master screams, before regaining control over himself. He thrusts the bug inches from Rory’s face, forcing Rory’s left eye open with his free hand.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“This isn’t fiction. This is real and it is going to hurt.” The Master delights in telling him. “This little fella is going to bury into your brain. It feeds off your brainwaves and amplifies them. It’s asexual and will reproduce inside your head. Soon, there’ll be hundreds of these little critters inside your brain. I’ll be able to pick up on your every little thought, even the ones you don’t want to have, especially the ones you don’t want to have. It’s going to bury through your body, feed off your thoughts and excrete energy that will reach every nerve in your body where it will be translated into pain.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">Rory doesn’t react with the terror the Master wants. Rory barely reacts at all, almost calm except for the solitary tear falling down his cheek. It’s not for himself though, and that confuses the Master. For a brief moment the Master isn’t sure he wants to get into Rory’s head. Then he reminds himself that Rory is his ticket off this rock and the hesitation is over. The Master carefully places the bug on Rory’s shoulder.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">The bug sits there for a few moments as the Master waits in anticipation. Rory’s breaths are laboured through the rope and becoming more shallow. He closes his eyes, trying to prepare himself but there was no way he could as the bug dives into his ear. Blood pours from every orifice Rory has. The stabbing pain in Rory’s head evolves into an electric throb throughout his entire body, growing to never-ending waves of increasing pain.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">Rory screams.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">The Master smiles.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style="">TBC<o:p></o:p></b></p>  <p class="MsoNormal"><o:p></o:p></p></lj-cut><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/71003.html">part four</a> <br /></o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNormal"><o:p> </o:p></p></meta></meta></meta></meta>

Fandom: Doctor Who
Title: Torture (02/10ish)
Characters: Rory and a not so original character
Rating: NC-17, very violent and dark.
Warning: This series includes death, mutilation and mental torture
Word Count: 880
Summary: Rory is being held captive... but by who?
Disclaimer: I really don’t own Doctor Who, this isn’t for profit.
Timeline: Takes place after Matt Smith’s first season as Doctor and it does include spoilers for that season.
Author’s Notes: written for  .

part one

 

 

Torture (part 02)

 

Rory slowly wakes, barely aware as reality slowly trickles in. He tries to open his eyes but they’re glued shut with blood. The first thing he becomes conscious of is the gag around his mouth, some sort of rope or twine, the threads tickling the back of his throat. He does his best not to vomit, death by choking on puke is not a very dignified way to go. The bullet wound to the stomach is a far more painful and much slower way to die. Rory finds it preferable.

 

He opens his eyes painfully and still finds darkness. It takes a few moments for his eyes to adjust. He’s in a basement of some sort, dark and wet but there is a window. Rory can see daylight outside, a dirt path with no signs of human or humanoid life. He looks around for a way out and spies a set of stairs which lead to a metal door. It’s only then that Rory realises his hands are tightly tied, the bindings digging into his wrists.

 

Then he remembers Chastity and the newborn girl. The nausea returns. Tears leak down his blood-stained cheeks but he can’t scream because of the rope in his throat. He glares at John Smith, noting the blood splatter on John’s white shirt and his bruised knuckles.

 

“I was beginning to think you’d never wake up.” John tells him. “And that would be a shame.” Rory shakes his head out of anger but the pain in his temple is suddenly blinding. “Shh, don’t try to speak.” John says softly. “I don’t want you to speak. I want you to think. Loudly.” Rory thinks of Chastity, of her newborn little girl. He thinks of the way Chastity told him proudly about her husband, their life, their beautiful house. He thinks of their cruel murder, senseless and sadistic. John hits him, so hard Rory almost gets whiplash from the way his head twists. Rory takes this as a good sign. Perhaps John has a conscience after all.

 

“I belong among the stars, not tied down to this backwater planet, tied down to one person.” John throws his wedding ring at Rory, catching him in the eye. “I could never have been happy here. I don’t want to be loved!” John’s foot comes to rest on the chair Rory is tied to. “I want to be worshipped!!! I want to see the worlds burn. I want to hear the screams. To drown out the sounds in my head. Tell me a story.” John asks, sounding almost hopeful. “Tell me what your life is like. Tell me what it’s like, travelling with the Doctor.” Rory tries his hardest not to think of the Doctor.

 

“I could tell the second I laid eyes on you.” John purrs, becoming alarmingly close to Rory and Rory can’t back away so he just closes his eyes and pretends he can’t feel John’s hot breath on his face. “I can smell it on you, you stink of Time! I can almost taste it. Who are you Rory Williams, what makes you so special? The Doctor has kept a lot of pets in his time but you’re different, I can see the memories bulging out of your skull, your tiny human brain shouldn’t be able to contain it.” Rory can feel the man, rummaging through his memories, memories Rory has tried hard to forget. Rory does his best to ignore the memories, thinking of blackness instead.

 

“You can’t block your thoughts from me, boy!” That earns Rory another smack across the cheeks, followed by John licking at the blood. “I can taste it, the years, impossible for a human. Just who are you Rory?” In Rory’s mind there is a mantra which has been there for almost two millennia. ‘I am Rory Williams!’ John smiles because that means nothing to him, and if it means nothing to him, he’s almost certain he can make it mean nothing to Rory.

 

“I’m terribly sorry, where are my manners?” John asks, loosening the rope around Rory’s mouth so it falls down to his neck, where John tightens it again, making it difficult to breathe but not impossible. It’s hard to swallow, the rope bruising his Adam’s apple but somehow he is able to work his throat enough to spit at John. “Now, that’s not very nice. Is it Rory?” John doesn’t look disgusted though, no, he runs his finger through the globule of spit that landed on his jacket before sucking his finger clean. It’s Rory who feels disgusted. “Not when I was about to tell you my true name.”

 

“I know who you are,” Rory growls. “You’re a monster!”

 

“Is that what you think of me?” John laughs. “Perhaps it’s true. After all, I only want you to know my name so that you can scream it out in pain. It’s really been far too long, I’ve missed the thrill.”

 

“You’re not going to find it with me!” Rory grits his teeth, determined.

 

“A challenge! How exciting!” John declares. “I still want you to know my name, and there’s nothing you can do to stop me.” Rory struggles against the ropes binding his wrists, he can feel them burning but he still fights. It’s the only thing he can do as the man’s lips brush against his ear. “I am the Master!”

 

TBC

   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Shading 2 Accent 3" />

   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 1 Accent 3" />
  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="66" SemiHidden="false"
   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium List 2 Accent 3" />
  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="67" SemiHidden="false"
   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 1 Accent 3" />
  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="68" SemiHidden="false"
   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 2 Accent 3" />
  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="69" SemiHidden="false"
   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 3 Accent 3" />
  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="70" SemiHidden="false"
   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Dark List Accent 3" />
  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="71" SemiHidden="false"
   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful Shading Accent 3" />
  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="72" SemiHidden="false"
   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Colorful List Accent 3" />

<![endif]-->  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style="">Fandom: </b>Doctor Who<br /><b style="">Title: </b>Torture (1/10ish)<br /><b style="">Characters: </b>Rory Williams, Original Character, a not so original character<br /><b style="">Rating: </b>NC-17, very violent and dark.<br /><b style="">Warning: </b>This series includes death, mutilation and mental torture<br /><b style="">Word Count: </b>1050 for this part<b style=""><o:p></o:p></b><br /><b style="">Summary: </b>Rory is left behind, but he finds someone to keep him company.<br /><b style="">Disclaimer: </b>I really don’t own Doctor Who, this isn’t for profit.<br /><b style="">Author’s Notes: </b>written for <lj comm="eleventy_kink"/> .</p>                  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"> </p><lj-cut text="Torture"><p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style=""><u>Torture<o:p></o:p></u></b></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“So where are we again?” Rory asks, because it looks just like Earth, the rural parts of Earth anyway. A lack of technology but Rory barely notices that. All he sees is a market place full of busy, joyful people. Rory looks at what they’re selling: food, ornaments, books, actual books with animal-skin covers and pages made from plants and Rory can’t even guess what the ink is made from. He forgets his question, distracted by the words inside the book which portray a fairytale world, one where good conquers all and love makes everything better. By the time he looks up, Amy and the Doctor are nowhere to be seen.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">Rory sighs. He places the book carefully back on the stall and starts walking back to the TARDIS. It’s on his way there that he bumps into a young woman, literally.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I am SO sorry,” Rory apologises. “I wasn’t looking where I was going, I am such a clutz, are you okay?”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I am fine,” She smiles sweetly, her hands moving from their place caressing her pregnancy bump as she holds out her hand, waiting for Rory to shake it, “My name is Chastity. Mrs Charity Smith.” She shows him her ring with pride. Rory fingers his own wedding ring nervously.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Oh, erm...” Rory belatedly shakes her hand, “Mine’s Rory.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“You look lost.” She tells him. “May I be of assistance?”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“That’s very kind of you,” Rory replies, “I’m not lost, I’m just a little alone.” She frowns. “I came here with friends, but they seem to have gone along without me. I thought I would just wait for them but I don’t know how long they’ll be.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I live not far from here.” Chastity informs him. “Would you like to come in and have some tea whilst you wait?”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I don’t want to cause any trouble.” Rory stutters. “Are you sure your husband won’t mind?”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“John has an uncanny ability to tell people’s true intentions.” She replies. “I doubt he’ll feel threatened by you.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Thanks.” Rory says flatly. Chastity wobbles on ahead of him and Rory has to jog a little to catch up. “Are you sure you should be out in your condition? You should be waited upon hand and foot-“</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Do you have any children?” Chastity asks.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Ah, no.” Rory replies nervously, not allowing himself to think about it. As an only child he always longed for a brother or a sister, someone to look after, somebody to love unconditionally, but he hasn’t had the nerve to bring up the subject with Amy. “What about you, is this one your first?”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Yes, I am very excited.” She grins, “I wouldn’t put this child at risk.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I know. I’m sorry.” Rory apologises, again. “I just... I fuss, I’m a worrier. Sorry.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Stop apologising.” She orders. “We’re here.” As soon as he’s inside the first thing he does is pull out a chair for her to sit on. “I thought I was making you some tea.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I can do that.” Rory assures her, assessing the kitchen. He finds the ingredients with little problem, waiting for the kettle to boil. Chastity watches him with open admiration,</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I’d swear you’ve been here before.” She remarks.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I’m familiar with the layout,” Rory confesses. “It’s just a question of common sense really, practicality. Plus I assumed you’d shout at me if I got it wrong.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I didn’t have to.” She smiles. He pours her drink and they sit down. They have a very civil chat: she tells him about her life, her husband, her house. She allows him to look at the Nursery, a wooden crib with soft knitted blankets. He compliments her on it, of course. He even helps to clean up the house a bit, a dab hand with the broom, a whizz with a cloth and hot water. He’s nervous though and it helps to keep his mind off Amy and the Doctor. The house is soon spick and spam. She’s so impressed she hugs him, and then promptly feels a pregnancy pang.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">Rory doesn’t panic. He learned a lot in the two thousand years. He’s never seen a birth so sudden, but then again she is an alien. He doesn’t have time to find her husband, within twenty minutes she’s fully dilated. Barely enough time to get hot towels, to sterilise the scissors ready to cut the umbilical cord, to comfort her and let her squeeze his arm as he helps deliver the baby, supporting the tiny child’s head.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“It’s a girl.” He announces, a little tearfully. He severs the umbilical cord and wraps the baby in a towel, passing her to her mother, before wiping his forehead, smearing it with blood accidentally. “Are you alright, I’m sorry I couldn’t offer you something for the pain, but you did it. You’re a mother!”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I’m a mother.” She repeats, glowing with pride and exertion.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I should go, find your husband.” Rory suggests.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“No need.” A man answers, a little taller than Rory with jet black hair, clean-shaven and wearing a cheap woollen suit. “I’m already here.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Sorry Mr. Smith, I would have tried to get you but there was no time.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“No, no, that’s perfectly understood.” John replies, before pulling a gun out of his pocket and shooting his wife in the leg.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“What the hell?! She did nothing wrong!” Rory shouts as the baby cries. Chastity struggles to stand up, rushing to the door but finds it locked. Rory confronts John. “She is your wife! She’s the mother of your child!”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“She is nothing!” John screams back. “I can’t believe what an idiot I was!” He scoffs. “Stranded on this pathetic little planet, I actually thought I could settle down. Who the hell was I kidding? I don’t belong here. This isn’t my life. You don’t deserve the life you have.” Rory has worked hard for his life, to prove himself. He desperately tries to disarm John Smith but it resolves in several fragments of metal being projected into his stomach and resting there, inside him.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">Rory clutches his stomach, trying to keep his internal organs internal. He’s doubled over on the floor, in agony as he watches John Smith reload his gun and shoot Chastity in the back as she tries to open the door. The baby has stopped crying. Rory screams in horror at the man capable of murdering his own new-born baby. He screams until his throat is roar, his stomach bleeding profusely, and the world fades to black.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">TBC</p></lj-cut><p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/70147.html">part two</a> </p></meta></meta></meta></meta>

<![endif]-->  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style="">Fandom: </b>NCIS<br /><b style="">Title: </b>Safe Space<br /><b style="">Characters: </b>Gibbs, McGee<br /><b style="">Rating: </b>PG for some emotional hurt/comfort<br /><b style="">Summary: </b>Gibbs finds a tearful McGee hiding in the elevator.<br /><b style="">Word Count: </b>470<br /><b style="">Time Line: </b>Set early/mid season 2<br /><b style="">Disclaimer: </b>I don’t own NCIS, oh, if only I did I wouldn’t have so many student debts chasing me. I don’t profit from this.<br /><b style="">AN: </b>Written for <lj comm="ncisdrabble100"/> , for the 196 “Elevator” challenge. Oh dear, this isn’t going to help convince some fangirls that I don’t HATE Abby. Please don’t flame me.</p>                  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"> </p><lj-cut text="Safe Space"><p class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style=""><u>Safe Space<o:p></o:p></u></b></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style=""><u><o:p><span style="text-decoration: none;"> </span></o:p></u></b></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">The elevator doors open and Gibbs quickly walks in, the doors closing behind him. It’s not until he halts the elevator between floors that he even acknowledges the younger man’s presence.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">Tim’s eyes are red and his lips swollen. It’s obvious he’s been crying pretty heavily, but to his credit he is putting on a brave face. It doesn’t last long, tears welling up until they escape in a heart-wrenching sob.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“Sorry, boss.” Tim apologises, doing his best to curb the tears but they still leak out.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“Don’t apologise.” Gibbs tells him. “It’s a sign of weakness.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“Yeah, because breaking down in tears in front of your boss is such a sign of strength and manliness.” McGee snarks. Gibbs fights a smile. Tim takes a deep breath, no longer crying but obviously still upset. He’s giving off ‘I want to be alone’ vibes, but Gibbs ignores those. He doesn’t say anything though, just glares at Tim until Tim has to tell him. “I got into a fight. Some pretty mean stuff was said. I shouldn’t let it get to me though.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“Abby, huh?” Gibbs takes a guess.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“She has a sharp tongue.” Tim huffs.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“Oh yeah.” Gibbs agrees.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“It’s stupid though.” Tim continues. “Tony teases me with stuff like that every day and I don’t react like this. I really thought she’d be the one, y’know, the one person who could accept me for all my flaws. I thought, with her, I could be a good catch instead of the bad fish. I was kidding myself.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“Hey, you are a good catch.” Gibbs tells him. “I caught you and put you on my team, didn’t I?” Tim smiles at that, which makes it worth while.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“It’s not the same thing.” Tim replies. “And besides, you didn’t catch me, I jumped into the boat.”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“Maybe, but I didn’t toss you back. That’s something.” Gibbs answers.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“Thank you.” Tim says, but the sadness is still evident in his eyes.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“Here.” Gibbs proffers his coffee. Tim looks at it, confused. “Take a sip.” Tim does, only because he’s told to. His eyes close as the rich flavour floods his taste-buds. It’s so good, he gives it back to Gibbs after a sip. “Coffee: makes everything better.” Gibbs states. Tim has to agree.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“It’s no chocolate, but it’s close.” Tim smiles. Gibbs makes a mental note to start carrying chocolate bars on him. “Thank you, boss. I’m almost ready to face the day. I just wish you didn’t have to see me like this.” Gibbs shakes his head.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“What happens in the elevator, stays in the elevator.” Gibbs whispers conspiratorially. “Out there I’m your hard-ass, slave-driving, impossible boss. You got that?”</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">“Sure thing boss.” Tim agrees, but his eyes look brighter and he looks happier.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing">Gibbs ain’t exactly unhappy either.</p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style="">FIN</b></p></lj-cut><p class="MsoNoSpacing"><b style=""><o:p></o:p></b></p></meta></meta></meta></meta>

It’s a guilty thought, which makes Rory stumble to his feet, away from the Doctor and the Doctor pouts.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">*****</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I thought you were a puppy!” The Doctor cries. “Puppies snuggle.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Maybe,” Rory can’t deny that snuggling with the Doctor does seem mightily appealing at the moment but he can’t, not yet. “But I need to tend to my Mistress first.”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Can we get a collar for him?” The Doctor asks sleepily.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Hmm, I am thinking of getting tags to make him wear.” Amy says slyly. <span style=""> </span>“Tags which say, <i style="">Property of Amelia Pond. </i>That way, you know he’s mine, and I can make you beg whenever you want to play with him.” Rory’s heart beats a little quicker at that idea, as well as the sound of longing the Doctor makes in the back of his throat. But now, he nuzzles against Amy’s neck, hinting for a kiss which she eagerly gives him.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Can I play with you, now?” Rory asks, so politely.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Can I watch?” The Doctor asks, punctuated with a yawn.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“If you can.” Amy smirks, but the Doctor can not keep his eyes open, his orgasm so intense that his body needs sleep to recuperate.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Was it good?” Rory questions, in need of her approval.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“Rory,” She chuckles, amazed. “You placed a Time Lord and a... Jeff, masturbation expert, into a sex coma!”</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">“I meant for you.” Rory adds. “Was it good for you?” Amy doesn’t answer, she just takes his hand and guides it under her skirt. She’s not wearing any knickers and the dampness between her legs is so severe it is starting to drip down her thighs. Oh yeah, she’s very aroused and she makes a mental note to start telling Rory that more, since he’s so adorably clueless.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">Rory falls gracefully to his knees as he starts to lick her pussy, his tongue flicking over the clit and within seconds she’s writhing in pleasure. She definitely wants to get some tags for Rory, to claim him as her own. She can’t wait to marry him, it’s just a piece of paper but the implications of it send a thrill down her spine. She’s so lucky, and now Jeff and the Doctor know just how lucky she is.</p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p> </o:p></p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing">FIN</p></lj-cut><p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"> </p>  <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p></o:p><o:p></o:p><o:p><br /></o:p></p>      <p style="text-align: justify;" class="MsoNoSpacing"><o:p></o:p><o:p></o:p><o:p><br /></o:p></p>    </meta></meta></meta></meta>
