<![endif]-->  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/67709.html">part one</a><br /><a href="http://beautybecks.livejournal.com/67343.html">part two</a></span><b style=""><u><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><br /><br /></span></u></b></p><lj-cut text="Dressing Down (3/3)"><p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><b style=""><u><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">Dressing Down (continued)<o:p></o:p></span></u></b></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“Krindor!” The Doctor calls out in concern. Krindor is bleeding black blood, a patch of fur on his head has been torn off. “What happened? Where’s Rory?” The Doctor asks, lamenting the lack of his sonic screwdriver.<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“I couldn’t protect him.” Krindor apologises. “You shouldn’t have let him come here. You should have marked him as your own. You’ve lost him now. You won’t be able to take him back.” Krindor informs the Doctor, even as Amy is tearing a piece off the tent and wrapping it around Krindor’s wounds. <o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“Where did they take him?” The Doctor asks frantically. <o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“You can’t get him back!” Krindor growls, before howling in pain. “I’m sorry, but what were you thinking? He has the mark of this planet on his person! He belongs to this world, the council can do with him as they wish.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“His birthmark!” Amy realises. “They can’t take him because of a birthmark!”<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“It’s the law here.” Krindor stresses. “They will not care if you are not aware of it. He is theirs.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“No!” The Doctor screams. “He is mine and I will NOT let any harm come to him. If they hurt him in ANY way they will pay for their cruelty. We will take him back, by force if necessary. I WILL get him back and that’s a promise.” The Doctor declares. <o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“I would like to help.” Krindor states, after he has taken a second to recover from the Doctor’s speech.<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“No. Out of the question.” The Doctor replies. “It was my ignorance that got him taken, I need to make it up to him personally.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“Doctor, calm down.” Amy pleads, her mind worried about Rory yet she doesn’t know he’s hurting but she can see the Doctor is. “We need a plan. We can’t just go in and demand they give us our Rory back.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“Oh I beg to differ.” The Doctor argues. “It’s always best to ask nicely first. We just need to find our way in.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“I may be able to help with that.” Krindor says, handing the Doctor a book. It is filled with maps, including one with directions to a castle, the meeting place of the council, and another map which dictates the layout of the castle itself. “I can still fight if you so wish.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“No thank you Krindor.” The Doctor declines. “You have done more than enough and hopefully, with the plans you have provided us with, there won’t have to be any fighting at all. Thank you.” The Doctor rushes away. Amy kisses Krindor’s matted fur and dashes off to follow the Doctor, panic starting to settle in so she pushes it back and continues moving forward.<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">***<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">The castle is rather large, so it takes a lot of running and hiding and sneaking before the Doctor and Amy finally come across the room Rory is being held in. He is being guarded by two humanoid creatures with beady eyes and pink wrinkly skin. Thank goodness Amy is able to use her womanly wiles on them, stealing the bigger one’s gun and shooting both of the guards with it. <o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“Please tell me that was a stun gun.” Amy pleads.<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“It was.” The Doctor assures her. “Just a mild electrical shock, enough to induce unconsciousness but not enough to kill anybody. Projectile weapons are banned here because of the marks they make.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“Doctor, Amy!” Rory calls out, pulling against the shackles, his wrists already bruised. “How is Krindor?” Rory asks, frantic with worry. The Doctor can see the tears streaking Rory’s cheeks, tears for Krindor, not for himself. “I told them they didn’t have to hurt him!!!” Rory screams that last part, hoping someone from the council will hear and realise how they’ve hurt such a sweet innocent man. Rory’s wrists start to bleed and the Doctor finds Rory’s compassion overwhelming. The Doctor has to swallow the lump in his throat before he’s able to speak.<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“He might have a scar but he’ll be fine.” The Doctor says, watching Rory nod as he comprehends this, still feeling guilty but able to relax a little.<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“I wasn’t sure you’d come for me –ow!” Rory winces and Amy smacks him upside the head, before kissing it better. “What’s going on? Why did they drag me here? Er... Doctor, what are you doing?” The Doctor leans into Rory’s personal space, looking deeply into his eyes before pressing his lips against Rory’s neck, licking tentatively before suddenly biting and sucking. “Er, Amy, what is he doing?”<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“I think he’s marking you.” Amy replies casually. “It’s a big thing on this world. The council took you because your birthmark is kind of like the symbol of this planet. If he can mark you he might be able to argue that you belong to him, and not the planet.” Amy explains. “Well, it’s either that or he just wants to.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“What is that?” Rory’s asks, his eyes widening.<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“Oh, it’s called an erection.” She teases, taking great delight in it. “I thought you’d know that.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“What is it doing against my thigh?” He asks Amy, since the Doctor is rather preoccupied. <o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“You should be honoured.” Amy replies. “He has a crush on you.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“And you’re okay with that?” Rory is surprised. She leers at him, letting him know that she’s more than ‘okay’ with it, she actually finds it hot. “Fine, just for now will you please get him off me before he starts humping my leg?” Amy watches and realises that the Doctor is about five seconds away from humping Rory’s leg, so she rolls her eyes and tugs at the Doctor’s shoulder. He makes a whimper at the loss, a sound barely human. “Don’t start that.” Rory warns. “I have been 100% heterosexual all my life and if you want me to reconsider that it might help if you starting doing something productive like, gee, I don’t know... get me out of these shackles!” There is silence for a few seconds, apart from the metal clang of the chains and the Doctor’s heavy breathing. <o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“I love it when you’re all forceful.” Amy purrs, kissing Rory as he tugs against the shackles, desperate to touch her as he lets his mouth slide from hers, biting at her chin before kissing her neck, marking her as he finds her pulse and sucks, bruising the skin and making her moan in delight. She’s even more delighted as she feels him growing hard against her. “God, you boys are so obvious. I love being a girl.” Amy smiles sweetly, knowing that Rory can’t truly know how aroused she is.<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“I’ll remind you of that next time it’s your time of the month.” Rory mutters under his breath. <o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“Perhaps not.” Amy corrects, rubbing her stomach absent-mindedly. “Other guys, if you talk about being on they run a mile, but you,” She kisses him, fondly, “you rub my tummy to ease the cramps, feed me chocolate to keep my hormone levels nice and have a cold cloth to keep me cool.” The Doctor looks a strange mix of terrified and horrified as he realises what they are talking about. He is so gay.<o:p></o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Arial","sans-serif";">“You have the ability to grow a little person inside of you!” Rory is still amazed by that. “Of course, the downside is the lining of your womb breaking down every month and your hormone levels and internal thermostat going a little wonky, I’m willing to put up with that.” Amy smiles at his modesty. He takes care of her so well, even if she doesn’t appreciate it at the time she appreciates it now. “Your body is amazing.” The awe in Rory’s voice makes Amy swell with pride. Fandom: Doctor Who
Title: Picky Eater
Pairing: Rory/Eleven UST
Rating: G
Word Count: 1650
Summary: Rory isn’t eating. The Doctor is worried. And he’s right to be.
Disclaimer: I don’t own the show, I’m just a fanatic.
AN: written for the  prompt, “picky eater”. It got too long, deviated from the prompt, became quite angsty and never included a hint of sex. I’m not quite sure what happened. Let me know what you think of it, please.

 

 

Picky Eater

 

 

“Rory,” The Doctor nudges his elbow. “You’ve got to eat something.”

 

“Do I?” Rory asks with a clenched jaw. Amy slows her slurping of the snozzberry soup but she doesn’t stop. “What about you Doctor? Don’t you have to eat?”

 

“Not really. It’s just fun.” The Doctor replies. “I’m sure we can order something else, even if it’s just nutritional supplements, some fgharkdsdol perhaps?”

 

“I’d rather not feed my body with things I can’t even pronounce. Thank you, though.” Even with a frank dismissal Rory is still incredibly polite. It only makes the Doctor worry more.

 

“What kind of Nurse are you? Letting your body starve. I’m not sure if you’ve noticed but I kind of attract trouble so you need to be light on your feet. Can’t have you too weak to run now, can I?” The Doctor smiles, but the worry behind it is evident. It makes Rory feel guilty.

 

“Is it..?” Rory starts then stops. “Can I?” Rory lets out a frustrated, shaky sigh. “Please can I borrow the TARDIS key? Maybe I can make myself a sandwich.”

 

“It’s a big deal getting a key.” The Doctor rambles. “I don’t give them out to just anyone.” Nor does he go grocery shopping, at all, but on Rory’s insistence the TARDIS’ kitchen is full of bread, milk and eggs all bought from Leadworth. The Doctor sighs and hands Rory the key. Rory trudges away, the Doctor watching him.

 

“Go after him!” Amy rolls her eyes. The Doctor’s is visibly shaking with the urge to run after Rory but still, he has to ask,

 

“Are you sure?”

 

“Do I look like I need you worrying about me?” Amy glares at him, shoving another spoonful of the snozzberry soup into her mouth. “Go after him!”

 

“Right.” The Doctor jogs after Rory.

 

***

 

Rory isn’t in the kitchen. The TARDIS won’t tell the Doctor where he is, which is mightily frustrating. She must like Rory a lot, if she’s willing to keep his secrets. The Doctor likes him too, so a little telepathic conversation and a somewhat heated argument with pleas from the Doctor lead to her directing him.

 

Rory is sat in a corridor, sat on the floor with his back against the wall, muttering to himself, lost in thought.

 

“You didn’t make that sandwich then.” The Doctor says to break the silence. Rory jumps, scrambling to his feet.

 

“Doctor, what? Why?” Rory growls at his sudden inability to form a complete sentence. “Where’s Amy?”

 

“She’s fine.” He assures Rory. “She’s a little worried.” Rory flinches, feeling guilty. “I’m more than a little worried.”

 

“I’m fine.” Rory says, even as he’s gnawing on his lip so hard he begins to draw blood.

 

“What’s going on in that head of yours?” The Doctor asks sadly, fingers brushing against Rory’s cheekbone in a gesture that makes a tear fall from him eye.

 

“I can’t live this life, it’s too alien.” Rory confesses. “The people; the places; the food: It’s too much!”

 

“I don’t think that’s it.” The Doctor’s eyes narrow as he stuffs his hands in his pocket. He doesn’t know how to touch Rory, how to comfort him. So far he’s only permitted himself quick pats or possibly too rough punches on the arm. Then there was the fact he just touched Rory’s cheekbone then, but that’s because it’s starting to stick out more than usual. He’s starting to look gaunt.

 

“There’s no going back.” Rory whispers. “One taste of life amongst the stars and I’ll die of starvation on Earth.”

 

“I didn’t know you were a poet, Rory.” Eleven sarcastically replies. “Mind you, Nurses are supposed to be sensitive, it’s what gives them their good bedside manner.”  Rory falls silent. “You do have a point though.” The Doctor admits, eventually. “I’m not very good at getting my companions back to Earth in one piece... but it’s such a spectacular journey!”

 

“It’s one I don’t deserve.” Rory admits so quietly, the tears falling silently down his cheeks. “I’m here because of Amy. On Earth I’m a small fish in a small pond. Out here I’m—“

 

“My companion.” The Doctor finishes for him. “You’re quiet, funny and oh so sweet. I am proud to have you on my crew. You make an effort to look after the TARDIS, fixing up my scrapes, telling me off when I get too careless.” He smiles. Rory doesn’t.

 

“When I was seventeen I saw a little boy, bite into a piece of supermarket cake.” Rory recalls. “I watched as his throat swelled up and his skin turned blue. I tried to call for help, I knew I needed an epi-pen, epinephrine or adrenaline but I had none. I watched him die. In boring Leadworth I saw a boy die and there were nothing I could do.”

 

“I’m sorry.” The Doctor offers and Rory does acknowledge it.

 

“So was I.” Rory admits. “I still am. I still was the day I saw a beautiful baby girl born two months premature and clinging to life despite all odds. Such a tiny little village but full of life and death, a microcosm of horror and beauty. In Leadworth I know my place. I like my place. I may just be Nurse Boy but I know my patients better than the Doctor’s do. I don’t know anything out here and I like knowing. I like knowing what I’m eating. I like knowing what species I’m talking to. I like being known. I used to think I was a pretty dependable guy, I used to think people depended on me but it’s just an illusion.”

 

“Ah, but that only matters if you look too closely.” The Doctor counters. “You’re too young to take things so seriously! Look at Amy, with her head in the clouds, always ready for an adventure. It’s no fun adventuring on your own, but Amy’s always one step ahead of me. We need you here to keep our feet on the ground.”

 

“Amy doesn’t listen to me, she never has.” Rory explains. “When I get lost I stay where I am. She wanders, she leaves me behind. But she always comes back.” Rory smiles, sadly.

 

“You, me and Amy: we’re a team.” The Doctor grins, his hands itching to trace the shape of Rory’s lips, or the crease in Rory’s forehead. “You don’t need a function, you’re not an object; you’re a person. It’s time to stop thinking of others and start living for yourself. Okay?”

 

“If that’s what you and Amy want.” Rory answers, a twinkle in his eye shows he understands the irony.

 

“I want you to be happy.” The Doctor answers, sincerely. “The three of us can travel through time and space but you’re here trapped in your own head.”

 

“”I could be bounded in a nutshell, and count myself a king of infinite space, were it not that I have bad dreams”” Rory quotes.

 

“Hamlet.” The Doctor recognises. “You’re not going mad, Rory.” At least, the Doctor hopes not.

 

“I’m on the verge of going catatonic Doctor.” Rory diagnoses. “I can feel it, like swimming through treacle. I don’t want to call it depression, but it might be.” Rory voices his thoughts. “I don’t have my routine. I don’t have my normal role. I feel superfluous, I feel my body shutting down but my mind is still active. Thoughts like blood mixing with water, I can’t pick any out, I can’t organise them, and I can’t get rid of them. You say I don’t need a function. I think I might have to disagree with that. Sorry.”

 

“You want a job to do, I’m sure I can find you one.” The Doctor suggests. “Whole of time and space, loads of people to help, people to save—“

 

“That’s kind of what I’m scared of.” Rory says. “Not that I’m scared, it’s just... that much power. We’re not Gods. What gives us the right to interfere? But if we don’t interfere, where is our humanity?”

 

“Oh Rory!” The Doctor finally gives into his instincts and pulls Rory into a hug, before tapping on his nose. “You need to stop thinking so much. Thoughts are bad, especially kept to yourself. Eat up at you and until you say them out loud you have no idea how stupid they are. You should talk more. I talk a lot. Helps keep me sane. Rory?”

 

“I’m fine, Doctor.” Rory insists.

 

“No you’re not. You just said so yourself. You really should listen to yourself Rory.” The Doctor scolds.

 

“It sounds crazy!” Rory cries out, before laughing which rapidly turns to sobbing. Rory grabs onto the Doctor, who holds him tight, kissing his hair.

 

“Oh Rory!” The Doctor sighs, allowing all his emotions to bleed into the way he says Rory’s name.

 

“We should keep moving. Go find Amy. She’ll make me smile.” Rory pulls back.

 

“We should get you something to eat.” The Doctor says before leaping into action, squeezing Rory’s bony shoulder before running off. Rory has only moved a few steps when the Doctor returns and hands Rory a computer tablet. “It’s a scanner. Point it at food and it will give you the ingredients, and the chemical compounds. Point it at a structure and it will give you the history. Point it at an alien and it will tell you all about the species. It lets you put information in as well, look at the keyboard. What do you think?” The Doctor looks at Rory, expectantly.

 

“Thank you.” Rory whispers, awed. He straps it to his left wrist, letting his fingers trail over the keys lovingly.

 

“You are adorable!” The Doctor blurts out. Rory frown before rolling her eyes.

 

“Don’t tell Amy that, she might get jealous.” Rory advises.

 

“Why not? She already knows you’re adorable.” The Doctor answers, making Rory laugh. The Doctor grins goofily. “Come on. I’ll buy you some chips.”

 

“No thanks Doctor.” Rory says, before smiling widely. “I’ll just steal some of yours.”

 

FIN

Hi, I'm beautybecks  and I have become addicted to memes. I saw the  meme and there were a couple of rpf prompts on there, which gave me the inspiration to find this community and propose a meme for  

The rules are simple: post an actor, pairing (threesome or more if you want to) and a prompt as a comment. You can post anonymously or as yourself but remember the comm rules of  , particularly no bashing. Open to het, slash or gen. If you prompt it, it may get written.

example:

Patrick Troughton, on playing a fool
Paul McGann/Daphne Ashbrooke, movie star
Matt Smith/Arthur Darvill, singing in the shower

If you write a fic in response to a comment, make sure to give the rating and other info in the header. This also helps a fic stand out from other comments.

Most of all, be respectful and have fun!
